2c92cee19c00fabf187493e2d45f0a87.title: Spinach ricotta frittata
2c92cee19c00fabf187493e2d45f0a87.description: This humble Italian egg dish couldn’t be simpler to assemble. The fillings can vary depending on your mood or what you have on hand but here, it’s a classic combination of fresh spinach and creamy ricotta cheese.

ingredients.name: Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value Whole Vitamin D Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz
Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Great Value Extra Virgin Olive Oil, 17 fl oz
Fresh Green Onions Bunch, Each
ingredients.description: 1 medium shallot, peeled and finely diced

ingredients.name: Marketside Fresh Baby Spinach, 6 oz Bag, Fresh
ingredients.description: 5 ounces fresh baby spinach (about 5 packed cups)

ingredients.name: Great Value Original Ricotta Cheese, 15 oz
Great Value Grated Parmesan Cheese, 8 oz
ingredients.description: 1 ounce Parmesan cheese (1/2 cup firmly packed freshly grated or 1/3 cup store-bought grated)

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Arrange a rack in the top third of the oven and heat the oven to 350 F.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Crack 8 large eggs into a large bowl and whisk until blended. Add the milk, salt and pepper. Whisk to combine.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Heat the oil in a 10-inch cast iron or oven-safe nonstick skillet over medium heat until shimmering. Add the shallot and sauté until softened, about 2 minutes. Add 5 ounces baby spinach, a handful at a time, and sauté until just wilted, about 2 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Spread the spinach mixture into an even layer, then pour the whisked eggs over the top, tilting the pan to make sure the eggs spread out evenly to the edges of the pan. Dollop the ricotta all over the surface of the eggs and sprinkle the Parmesan over the top. Cook, undisturbed, until the eggs at the edges of the pan just begin to set, about 2 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake until the eggs are just set, 18 to 20 minutes. Pierce the center of the frittata with a paring knife: It should come out clean without any raw, wet egg. If not, continue to bake until it does.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Switch the oven to broil on high. Broil until the top of the frittata is golden-brown in spots, about 3 minutes. Let cool in the pan for at least 10 minutes. Slice into wedges and serve warm or at room temperature.

ingredients.name: Fresh Banana Fruit, Each
Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value Pure Vanilla Extract, 1 fl oz
Great Value  Quick Oats, 18 oz Canister
Great Value Kosher Ground Cinnamon, 2.5 Oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Mash bananas in a large bowl until smooth. Mix in eggs and vanilla until well combined, then mix in oats and cinnamon.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Heat a skillet to medium and add in a scoop* of the pancake batter. Smooth out to form an even layer. Cook for about 2-3 minutes until you start to see bubbles releasing from the top of the batter. Flip and cook until the other side is golden brown, about 1-2 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Garnish your pancakes with your favorite toppings! We used banana slices, chopped walnuts & maple syrup.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: *Note: Use 1/2 cup (65) for scooping the batter to yield 4 thicker pancakes; Use 1/3 cup (40 g) to yield 6 smaller pancakes

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: King Arthur Flour Unbleached All-Purpose Flour 5 lb. Bag
Great Value Spring Water, 1 Gallon
Great Value 2% Reduced Fat Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz
Great Value Sugar Cannister 20oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
Fleischmann's Active Dry Yeast, 0.75 Oz, 3 Pack
Great Value Sweet Cream Unsalted Butter, 16 oz
ingredients.description: 3 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened,1 1/4 cups cold unsalted butter, cut into ½-inch (1 cm) thick slices

ingredients.name: Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value Milk Chocolate Bar, 3.52 oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: In a large bowl, mix the flour, water, milk, sugar, salt, yeast, and butter.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Once the dough starts to clump, turn it out onto a clean counter.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Lightly knead the dough and form it into a ball, making sure not to over-knead it.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Cover the dough with plastic wrap and refrigerate for one hour.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Slice the cold butter in thirds and place it onto a sheet of parchment paper..

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Place another piece of parchment on top of the butter, and beat it with a rolling pin.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Keeping the parchment paper on the butter, use a rolling pin to roll the butter into a 7-inch (18 cm) square, ½-inch (1 cm) thick. If necessary, use a knife to trim the edges and place the trimmings back on top of the butter and continue to roll into a square.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Transfer the butter layer to the refrigerator.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: To roll out the dough, lightly flour the counter. Place the dough on the counter, and push the rolling pin once vertically into the dough and once horizontally to form four quadrants.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Roll out each corner and form a 10-inch (25 cm) square.

tasks.title: Step 11
tasks.instruction: Place the butter layer on top of the dough and fold the sides of the dough over the butter, enclosing it completely.

tasks.title: Step 12
tasks.instruction: Roll the dough with a rolling pin to seal the seams, making sure to lengthen the dough, rather than widening it.

tasks.title: Step 13
tasks.instruction: Transfer the dough to a baking sheet and cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 1 hour.

tasks.title: Step 14
tasks.instruction: Roll out the dough on a floured surface until it’s 8x24 inches (20x61 cm).

tasks.title: Step 15
tasks.instruction: Fold the top half down to the middle, and brush off any excess flour.

tasks.title: Step 16
tasks.instruction: Fold the bottom half over the top and turn the dough clockwise to the left. This completes the first turn.

tasks.title: Step 17
tasks.instruction: Cover and refrigerate for one hour.

tasks.title: Step 18
tasks.instruction: Roll out the dough again two more times, completing three turns in total and refrigerating for 1 hour in between each turn. If at anytime the dough or butter begins to soften, stop and transfer back to the fridge.

tasks.title: Step 19
tasks.instruction: After the final turn, cover the dough with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight.

tasks.title: Step 20
tasks.instruction: To form the croissants, cut the dough in half. Place one half in the refrigerator.

tasks.title: Step 21
tasks.instruction: Flour the surface and roll out the dough into a long narrow strip, about 8x40 inches (20x101 cm).

tasks.title: Step 22
tasks.instruction: With a knife, trim the edges of the dough.

tasks.title: Step 23
tasks.instruction: Cut the dough into 4 rectangles.

tasks.title: Step 24
tasks.instruction: Place the chocolate on the edge of the dough and roll tightly enclosing it in the dough.

tasks.title: Step 25
tasks.instruction: Place the croissants on a baking sheet, seam side down.

tasks.title: Step 26
tasks.instruction: Repeat with the other half of the dough.

tasks.title: Step 27
tasks.instruction: Brush the croissants with the beaten egg. Save the rest of the egg wash in the fridge for later.

tasks.title: Step 28
tasks.instruction: Place the croissants in a warm place to rise for 1-2 hours.

tasks.title: Step 29
tasks.instruction: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).

tasks.title: Step 30
tasks.instruction: Once the croissants have proofed, brush them with one more layer of egg wash.

tasks.title: Step 31
tasks.instruction: Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. Serve warm.

tasks.title: Step 32
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Great Value Whole Vitamin D Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz
ingredients.description: 2 cups whole milk, warm to the touch for dough

ingredients.name: Great Value Sugar Cannister 20oz
Great Value Sweet Cream Unsalted Butter, 16 oz
ingredients.description: 8 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted for dough,12 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened for filling,2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted for frosting

ingredients.name: Great Value Active Dry Yeast, 0.25 oz, 3 Count
ingredients.description: 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast for dough

ingredients.name: King Arthur Flour Unbleached All-Purpose Flour 5 lb. Bag
ingredients.description: 5 cups all-purpose flour, divided for dough

ingredients.name: Great Value Double Acting Baking Powder, 8.1 oz
Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce
Great Value Light Brown Sugar, 32 oz
ingredients.description: 3/4 cup light brown sugar for filling

ingredients.name: Great Value Kosher Ground Cinnamon, 2.5 Oz
Great Value Cream Cheese, 8 oz
ingredients.description: 4 oz cream cheese, softened and cubed for frosting

ingredients.name: Great Value 2% Reduced Fat Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz
Great Value Pure Vanilla Extract, 1 fl oz
Great Value Confectioners Powdered Sugar, 32 oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Make the dough: In a large bowl, whisk together the warm milk, sugar, and melted butter. The mixture should be just warm, registering between 100-110°F (37-43°C). If any warmer, allow to cool slightly.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Sprinkle the yeast evenly over the milk mixture, stir, and let sit in a warm place for about 10 minutes until the yeast has bloomed.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Add 4 cups (500 g) of flour to the milk mixture and stir with a wooden spoon until just combined.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Cover the bowl with a kitchen towel or plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place for 1 hour, until nearly doubled in size.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Generously butter 2 9-inch (23 cm) round baking pans and set aside.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Make the filling: In a medium bowl, combine the brown sugar, butter, and cinnamon. Mix well, then set aside.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Remove the plastic wrap from the dough and add the remaining cup of flour, baking powder, and salt. Stir well, then turn out onto a clean surface. Leave a bit of flour nearby to use as needed, but try not to incorporate too much.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Knead the dough for at least 10 minutes, adding more flour as necessary, until the dough just loses its stickiness and does not stick to the surface or your hands. The dough should be very smooth and spring back when poked.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Roll the dough out into a large rectangle, about 1/2-inch (1 cm) thick. Fix the corners with a bench scraper or a spatula to make sure they are sharp and even.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Spread the filling evenly over the dough.

tasks.title: Step 11
tasks.instruction: Starting from one short end, roll up the dough into a log and pinch the seam closed. Place seam-side down. Trim any uneven ends.

tasks.title: Step 12
tasks.instruction: Using unflavored dental floss, cut the log into evenly pieces, about 1 1/2 inches (8cm) thick. Place the cinnamon rolls in the prepared pans, 1 in the center and about 5 around the sides. Cover with a towel and let rise in a warm place for 35-45 minutes, until expanded by about half of their original volume. If you’re saving the cinnamon rolls for later, cover with plastic wrap and freeze for up 3 months.

tasks.title: Step 13
tasks.instruction: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).

tasks.title: Step 14
tasks.instruction: Bake the cinnamon rolls for 25-30 minutes, until golden brown.

tasks.title: Step 15
tasks.instruction: While the cinnamon rolls are baking, make the frosting: In a medium bowl, whisk together the cream cheese, melted butter, milk, and vanilla extract until smooth. Gradually add the powdered sugar and whisk until homogenous and runny.

tasks.title: Step 16
tasks.instruction: When the cinnamon rolls are finished, let cool for about 10 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 17
tasks.instruction: Drizzle the frosting over the cinnamon rolls, using the back of a spoon to spread if desired.

tasks.title: Step 18
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ea52db2decf1e5112fc5293ca5ed4c29.title: Strawberry stuffed waffles
ea52db2decf1e5112fc5293ca5ed4c29.description: Take your breakfast up a notch with these with just 4 ingredients.  Effortlessly fill your waffles by using store-bought biscuit dough. Slice each waffle pocket for a gooey strawberry surprise.

ingredients.name: Great Value Canola Oil Non-Stick Cooking Spray, 8 oz
Pillsbury Grands! Buttermilk Biscuits Frozen Dough, Value Pack, 20 ct., 41.6 oz.
ingredients.description: 2 cans (16 oz) honey butter or buttermilk biscuits

ingredients.name: Great Value Strawberry Pie Filling or Topping, 21 oz
Fresh Strawberries, 1 lb
ingredients.description: 8 oz fresh strawberries, cleaned and sliced

ingredients.name: Great Value Confectioners Powdered Sugar, 32 oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Spray the waffle iron with cooking spray and preheat to medium heat.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Separate each biscuit. Use fingers to stretch and flatten biscuits to 4-5 inches.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Use a tablespoon to drain the excess syrup from the strawberry filling. Scoop a heaping spoonful of the strawberry filling onto the center of a biscuit, leaving a perimeter around the filling.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Top with a second biscuit and pinch the edges to secure the waffle is closed. Repeat for remaining biscuits. Place the stuffed waffles in the waffle iron and cook for 5-6 minutes or until golden brown.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Top with fresh strawberries, sprinkle with powdered sugar and serve warm.

0371973d5165533b59fe20eada07f0f6.title: Cacio e pepe popovers
0371973d5165533b59fe20eada07f0f6.description: Popovers are a treat that are as fun to make as they are to enjoy. They rise high in the oven and almost topple over before they’re enjoyed warm and steamy. They’re crisp and golden on the outside while almost custardy on the inside. Traditionally, popovers are best served slathered with butter and jam as a morning treat, but this savory iteration takes cues from Italy instead.

ingredients.name: Great Value 2% Reduced Fat Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz
Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value Extra Virgin Olive Oil, 17 fl oz
ingredients.description: 3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for greasing the pan

ingredients.name: GV All Purpose Flour 2LB Bag
Great Value Grated Parmesan and Romano Cheese, 8 oz
ingredients.description: 1 ounce Pecorino Romano cheese (1/2 cup firmly packed freshly grated or 1/3 cup store-bought grated)

ingredients.name: McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Arrange a rack in the lower third of the oven and place a 12-cup regular muffin tin or a 6-cup popover tin on the rack. Heat the oven to 450 F.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Whisk the milk, eggs and olive oil in a large bowl until well-combined. Add the flour, grated cheese, freshly ground black pepper and salt and whisk until lightly frothy; a few small lumps are okay. Let the mixture rest for 10 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Carefully remove the hot pan from the oven and brush the inside of the cups, edges and the area between the cups with olive oil. Divide the batter evenly so that each cup is about two-thirds to three-quarters full.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Return the pan to the oven and bake for 15 minutes. (Do not open the oven door during baking as it will cause the popovers to deflate.) Reduce the oven temperature to 350 F and continue to bake until the popovers are golden-brown and have risen quite high, 10 to 15 minutes more.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Remove from the oven and turn the popovers out onto a wire cooking rack. (Use a knife to pop out any popovers from the pan that might have stuck) Pierce the bottom of each popover with a knife or fork to allow steam to escape. Enjoy immediately, while still warm.

4af8d94591bf35ccc174d9408a1cc32c.title: Sour cream coffee cake
4af8d94591bf35ccc174d9408a1cc32c.description: This coffee cake needs an hour to cool before slicing. It’ll still be warm at this point (and I imagine you’ll want to dive in as soon as you can), but it’s also fantastic at room temperature if you can’t get to it at that moment. And, as its name implies, the cake is perfect alongside a cup of coffee. Generously dust with powdered sugar and you’re ready to crumble!

ingredients.name: Great Value Light Brown Sugar, 32 oz
ingredients.description: 3/4 cup light brown sugar, packed, for filling,3/4 cup light brown sugar, packed, for streusel

ingredients.name: Great Value Kosher Ground Cinnamon, 2.5 Oz
ingredients.description: 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon, for filling,1 tablespoon ground cinnamon, for streusel

ingredients.name: GV All Purpose Flour 2LB Bag
ingredients.description: 1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour, for streusel,2 cups all-purpose flour, for cake

ingredients.name: Great Value Chopped Walnuts, 8 oz
ingredients.description: 1/3 cup chopped pecans or walnuts (optional), for streusel,2/3 cup chopped pecans or walnuts (optional), for cake

ingredients.name: Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce
ingredients.description: 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, for streusel,3/4 teaspoon kosher salt, for cake

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweet Cream Unsalted Butter, 16 oz
ingredients.description: 8 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted and cooled, for streusel,8 tablespoons (1 stick) unsalted butter, softened, for cake

ingredients.name: Great Value Double Acting Baking Powder, 8.1 oz
Great Value Baking Soda, 16 oz
C&H Premium Pure Cane Granulated Sugar, 1 lb Box
Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value All Natural Sour Cream, 8 oz Tub
ingredients.description: 1 cup sour cream, room temperature, for cake

ingredients.name: Great Value 2% Reduced Fat Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz
ingredients.description: 1/4 cup milk, room temperature, for cake

ingredients.name: Great Value Pure Vanilla Extract, 1 fl oz
ingredients.description: 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract, for cake

ingredients.name: Great Value Confectioners Powdered Sugar, 32 oz
ingredients.description: powdered sugar, for dusting, for cake

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Adjust an oven rack to the middle position and heat to 350 F. Coat the bottom and sides of a 9-inch springform pan with butter. (Tip: Use the softened butter wrapper.)

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In a small bowl, combine brown sugar and cinnamon.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: In a medium bowl, whisk r flour, brown sugar, nuts, cinnamon and salt until combined. Pour in cooled, melted butter and gently fold with a fork until clumps form and butter is fully incorporated. (Don’t use hot butter and don’t overmix. Doing either of these things will create a pasty topping; you want clumps.) Set filling and streusel aside.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: In a medium bowl, whisk flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt until combined.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: In a large bowl, beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Beat in eggs, one at a time, until incorporated. Beat in sour cream, milk and vanilla until blended. Add the flour mixture to the wet ingredients and beat until just combined. (Don’t overmix; the batter will be thick.) Scoop half the batter into the pan, using an offset spatula to smooth out the top. Sprinkle with cinnamon-sugar filling, then with ? cup nuts, if using. Dollop remaining batter on top and gently smooth with the offset spatula. Scatter streusel evenly on top.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Bake until the cake is golden-brown and a cake tester inserted into the center comes out clean, 50 to 55 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes, then gently run an offset spatula around the circumference of the cake. Release pan from ring form but keep on the bottom. Transfer to a cooling rack for 1 hour, then remove bottom if displaying the cake on a platter. (Tip: Use an offset spatula or a knife to loosen the cake.) Sprinkle cake with powdered sugar. Slice into wedges and serve warm or at room temperature.

99106789290167b91583538ff30bf45c.title: Tropical paradise smoothie bowls
99106789290167b91583538ff30bf45c.description: Indulge in a little island paradise with this recipe for a Tropical Smoothie Bowl. Grab your blender and layer in the ingredients to create a thick, creamy base. Top it off with whatever fruits or other toppings you like best!

ingredients.name: Savia Coconut Milk, 13.5 fl oz
ingredients.description: 1 cup coconut milk,  almond milk, or preferred milk

ingredients.name: Great Value Mixed Fruit, Frozen, 16 oz
ingredients.description: 1 (16 oz bag) frozen mixed fruit (bananas, strawberries, pineapples)

ingredients.name: Great Value Organic Strained Raw Honey, 12 oz Inverted Plastic Bottle
Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce
Great Value Oats & Honey Granola, 11 oz
Great Value Sweetened Coconut Flakes, 7 oz
Marketside Organic Bananas, Bunch
ingredients.description: Fresh sliced fruit(mango banana pineapple strawberries), optional

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: To a high-powered blender, in this order, add Coconut Milk (1 cup) , then Frozen Mixed Fruit (1 bag) , then Honey (2 Tbsp) , and Kosher Salt (1/4 tsp) .

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Turn the blender to low speed for 5 seconds, then gradually increase the blending speed until smooth. Use the tamper to move ingredients around if they get stuck. The mixture should be thicker than a smoothie you would drink.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Pour the smoothie into a serving bowl, add desired toppings like Granola (to taste) , Unsweetened Coconut Flakes (to taste) , Fresh Fruits (to taste) , and serve immediately while cold!

ingredients.name: Great Value Distilled Water, 1 Gallon
Great Value Sugar Cannister 20oz
DeLallo, Gluten Free, Non-GMO, Instant Espresso Powder for Baking & Drinks, 100% Instant Coffee, Naturally Caffeinated, 1.94 oz Jar
Great Value 2% Reduced Fat Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Add the hot water, sugar, and instant coffee to a bowl.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Either hand whisk or use an electric mixer until the mixture is fluffy and light.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: To serve, spoon a dollop over a cup of milk with ice in it and stir.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweet Cream Salted Butter, 16 oz
Great Value Kosher Ground Cinnamon, 2.5 Oz
Great Value Canola Oil Non-Stick Cooking Spray, 8 oz
Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value 2% Reduced Fat Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
Great Value Sugar Cannister 20oz
Great Value Thick Sliced Texas Toast, 20 oz
Baker's Imitation Vanilla Flavor, 8 fl oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C).

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Spray a large baking sheet with cooking spray.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Stack and slice the Texas toast into thirds.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, butter, vanilla, cinnamon, salt, and sugar.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Dunk each strip of bread into the mixture, allow the excess to drip off, then place on prepared baking sheet. Repeat with remaining strips.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Bake for 15-20 minutes, flipping halfway.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Remove from oven and serve.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: NOTE: To freeze, let the sticks cool slightly and transfer baking sheet to freezer. Once frozen, after 1-2 hours, transfer to a freezer bag for easy storage.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: To reheat, preheat oven to 350°F (180°C) and bake for 10-15 minutes until heated through. OR transfer frozen sticks to a plate and microwave 45-60 seconds.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

e2a73369298d1d4ce5cc2982a922c791.title: Perfect chocolate chip muffins
e2a73369298d1d4ce5cc2982a922c791.description: There’s nothing complicated about making great chocolate chip muffins, but a few tips will set you up for success. First, it’s important to not overmix the batter. Stirring it excessively results in tough muffins, which is the last thing you’re after. Instead, stir it just until there are no dry spots — some small lumps in the batter are okay. Next, keep a close eye on the muffins once they’re in the oven.

ingredients.name: Great Value Whole Vitamin D Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz
Great Value Sweet Cream Unsalted Butter, 16 oz
ingredients.description: 1/4 cup unsalted butter, melted and slightly cooled

ingredients.name: Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value Pure Vanilla Extract, 1 fl oz
GV All Purpose Flour 2LB Bag
C&H Premium Pure Cane Granulated Sugar, 1 lb Box
Great Value Double Acting Baking Powder, 8.1 oz
Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce
Nestle Toll House Semi Sweet Chocolate Baking Chips, 12 oz Bag

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Arrange a rack in the middle of the oven and preheat to 375 F. Line a standard 12-well muffin pan with paper liners or coat with cooking spray.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In a medium bowl, whisk milk, butter, eggs and vanilla together until combined.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: In a separate large bowl, whisk flour, 1/2 cup sugar, baking powder and salt together. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix with a sturdy rubber spatula or wooden spoon until just combined. Some small lumps are fine. Add chocolate chips and fold until just distributed; do not overmix.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Divide the batter among the prepared muffin wells and sprinkle with the remaining 2 teaspoons sugar. Bake until the muffins are golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, 18 to 20 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes before removing the muffins from the pan.

63374aedd28f17e29fe323a73c1fe1b3.title: The best ever vegan cinnamon rolls
63374aedd28f17e29fe323a73c1fe1b3.description: The Best Ever Vegan Cinnamon Rolls

ingredients.name: Miyoko's Creamery European Style Cultured Vegan Butter, 8 oz
ingredients.description: 2 tablespoons vegan butter, to coat the foil pan,1/2 cup vegan butter, melted for dough,3/4 cup vegan butter for filling

ingredients.name: Great Value Original Unsweetened Almond Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz
ingredients.description: 2 cups almond milk, at room temperature for dough,2 tablespoons almond milk for icing

ingredients.name: Great Value Organic Granulated Cane Sugar, 2 Lb
Great Value Active Dry Yeast, 0.25 oz, 3 Count
ingredients.description: 1 packet active dry yeast for dough

ingredients.name: King Arthur Flour Unbleached All-Purpose Flour 5 lb. Bag
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
Great Value Light Brown Sugar, 32 oz
Great Value Kosher Ground Cinnamon, 2.5 Oz
Great Value Confectioners Powdered Sugar, 32 oz
Great Value Pure Vanilla Extract, 1 fl oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Generously rub two disposable foil pie pans with vegan butter.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In a large bowl, whisk together the almond milk, melted butter, and sugar. The mixture should be just warm, registering between 100-110°F (37-43°C). If it is hotter, allow to cool slightly.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Sprinkle the yeast evenly over the warm mixture and let set for 1 minute.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Add 5 cups flour and 1 teaspoon of salt to the milk mixture and mix with a wooden spoon until just combined.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Cover the bowl with a towel or plastic wrap and set in a warm place to rise for 1 hour.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C).

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: After 1 hour, the dough should have nearly doubled in size.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Remove the towel and add an additional ½ cup (95g) of flour and salt. Stir well, then turn out onto a well-floured surface.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Knead the dough lightly, adding additional flour as necessary, until the dough just loses its stickiness and does not stick to the surface.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Roll the dough out into a large rectangle, about 1/2-inch (1 cm) thick. Fix corners to make sure they are sharp and even.

tasks.title: Step 11
tasks.instruction: Spread the softened vegan butter evenly over the dough.

tasks.title: Step 12
tasks.instruction: Sprinkle evenly with brown sugar and cinnamon.

tasks.title: Step 13
tasks.instruction: Roll up the dough, forming a log, and pinch the seam closed. Place seam-side down. Trim off any unevenness on either end.

tasks.title: Step 14
tasks.instruction: Cut the log in half, then divide each half into 7 evenly sized pieces. About 1 1/2 inches (8 cm) thick each.

tasks.title: Step 15
tasks.instruction: Place 7 cinnamon rolls in each cake pan, one in the center, six around the sides. Cover with plastic wrap and place in a warm place to rise for 30 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 16
tasks.instruction: To prepare the frosting. In a medium-size mixing bowl, whisk together powdered sugar, almond milk, and vanilla until smooth.

tasks.title: Step 17
tasks.instruction: Remove plastic wrap. Bake the cinnamon rolls in a preheated oven at 350°F (180°C) for 25-30 minutes, until golden brown.

tasks.title: Step 18
tasks.instruction: While still warm, drizzle evenly with frosting.

tasks.title: Step 19
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

64fd5feda37bd63bde78ccb3b5a03b87.title: Bbq pulled pork huevos rancheros
64fd5feda37bd63bde78ccb3b5a03b87.description: This is a great recipe to use up your holiday leftover roast! Also good with other meats like turkey, ham, or pastrami. This time we use canned pulled pork for a light and effortless family breakfast. Pulled Pork Huevos Rancheros are the ultimate in hearty convenient food. If you like Mexican food, you will love it! With the creamy texture of the refried beans, the crunch of the crispy corn tortilla, and the runny egg yolk, this dish has an explosion of taste!

ingredients.name: Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
La Banderita Yellow Corn 6" Tortillas, 30 ct
LLOYD'S Shredded Pulled Pork in Barbecue Sauce, Fully Cooked, 16 oz
ingredients.description: 2 cans (10.5 oz) Canned BBQ Pulled Pork

ingredients.name: Great Value Traditional Refried Beans, 16 Oz
HERDEZ Salsa Verde, 7 oz Tray
Crisco Pure Vegetable Oil, 16 fl oz
Great Value Original Ricotta Cheese, 15 oz
Yellow Onions, Each
Fresh Cilantro, Bunch
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Fresh Jalapeno Pepper, Approx. 3-5 per 0.25 Pound
ingredients.description: Sliced Jalapen~o Peppers for garnish (optional) to taste

ingredients.name: Great Value All Natural Sour Cream, 8 oz Tub
ingredients.description: Sour Cream for garnish (optional) to taste

ingredients.name: Fresh Iceberg Lettuce, Each
ingredients.description: Finely Shredded Lettuce for garnish (optional) to taste

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: In a frying pan over medium-low heat, heat up 2 Tbsp of Oil (2 Tbsp) . Add the Refried Beans (1 cup) , and heat up for about 1-2 minutes. Remove from the heat, transfer to a bowl and set aside.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In the same frying pan, over medium-high heat, heat up 4 Tbsp of Oil (1/4 cup) . Add Canned BBQ Pulled Pork (2 cans) to the hot pan and toss, allowing it to fry until the edges become caramelized and crispy, about 5 minutes. Stir often to avoid sticking on the bottom. Transfer to a separate bowl and set aside.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: In a separate frying pan over low heat, pour 1 1/2 cups of Oil (1 1/2 cups) . When the oil is heated up, carefully lay the Yellow Corn Tortillas (6) and fry until golden brown on one side (about 30 seconds).

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Use tongs to gently flip over the tortilla and fry the other side until golden brown. Transfer to a paper towel and set aside. Repeat this process on the remaining corn tortillas. Add more oil for frying if necessary.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Transfer the remaining Oil (2 Tbsp) into a heatproof bowl for future use, leaving about 4 Tbsp of oil in the pan.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Bring the pan over medium-low heat, crack the Eggs (6) into the pan and fry until the whites are set all the way through and the yolk is still runny (about 3 minutes), or to your preferred doneness. Season with Salt (to taste) and Ground Black Pepper (to taste) . Repeat this process on the remaining eggs.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: While the eggs are cooking, begin assembling your plate. On a serving plate, in this order, stack the prepared tortilla, refried beans, pulled pork, Tomatillo Salsa (1 cup) , and Yellow Onion (1) . You can also add Jalapeño Peppers (to taste) to add some heat to your stack, Lettuce (to taste) for extra crunchiness, and Sour Cream (to taste) .

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Use a spatula to transfer the fried egg onto the stack. Sprinkle with Ricotta Cheese (1 cup) and Fresh Cilantro (1 bunch) . Serve immediately.

50b7994f72502f028bc4ac6e103df35e.title: Skillet blueberry pancake
50b7994f72502f028bc4ac6e103df35e.description: This skillet blueberry pancake is as fluffy and tender as your favorite diner stack, thanks to tangy buttermilk in the batter and a kiss of melted butter. It bakes up thick, with browned, crispy edges, and generously feeds six. Serve it dusted with powdered sugar and of course, plenty of maple syrup for drizzling.

ingredients.name: GV All Purpose Flour 2LB Bag
C&H Premium Pure Cane Granulated Sugar, 1 lb Box
Great Value Double Acting Baking Powder, 8.1 oz
Great Value Baking Soda, 16 oz
Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce
Crystal Creamery Old World Style Bulgarian Cultured Buttermilk, 1 Quart
Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value Sweet Cream Unsalted Butter, 16 oz
ingredients.description: 3 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted and slightly cooled, divided

ingredients.name: Fresh Blueberries, 11 oz or 1 Pint
Great Value Confectioners Powdered Sugar, 32 oz
Maple Grove Farms Organic Pure Maple Syrup, 8.5 fl oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Arrange a rack in the top third of the oven and preheat the oven to 375 F. Place a 10-inch cast-iron skillet (or other nonstick oven-safe pan) in the oven to heat up.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt. In a separate bowl, whisk together buttermilk, eggs and 2 tablespoons melted butter. Pour buttermilk mixture into flour mixture and stir until just combined (a few small lumps are fine; do not overmix).

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Carefully remove the hot skillet from the oven. Drizzle the remaining 1 tablespoon melted butter into the pan and tilt to coat the bottom and sides. Pour the batter into the pan and spread it out into an even layer. Sprinkle evenly with blueberries. Return the skillet to the oven and bake until the pancake is puffed, golden-brown and a cake tester inserted into the center comes out clean, 25 to 30 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes before dusting with powdered sugar, cutting into wedges and serving with maple syrup.

ingredients.name: Great Value Sliced Bananas, 16 oz (Frozen)
Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value Pure Vanilla Extract, 1 fl oz
Mom's Best Cereals Whole Grain Oatmeal, Quick Oats, 16 Oz
Fresh Blueberries, 11 oz or 1 Pint

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Mash the bananas in a large bowl until smooth. Mix in the eggs and vanilla until well combined, then mix in the oats. Carefully fold in the blueberries.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Heat a medium nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add a scoop of the pancake batter. Smooth out to form an even layer. Cook for 2–3 minutes until you start to see bubbles forming on the surface. Flip and cook until the other side is golden brown, 1–2 minutes more.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Garnish your pancakes with your favorite toppings! We like Greek yogurt, granola, fresh blueberries, and/or maple syrup.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Marketside Chicken Apple Sausage 12oz
Yellow Onions, Each
Fresh Whole White Mushrooms, 8 oz
Great Value Chopped Spinach, 12 oz (Frozen)
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value 2% Reduced Fat Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz
Pillsbury Premade Refrigerated Pie Crusts, 2 Count
Great Value Finely Shredded Parmesan Cheese, 6 oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Cook sausage over medium-high until lightly browned, about 5-7 minutes, being sure to break up the meat into a fine mince.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Remove cooked sausage from pan and wipe away excess fat with a paper towel.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Add onion and sauté until softened and translucent, about 2 to 3 minutes. Add mushrooms, salt, and pepper and continue to cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Add chopped spinach and cook until wilted and no extra liquid has accumulated in the bottom of the pan.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: NOTE: Do your best to use the excessive moisture of the spinach and mushrooms to deglaze the bottom of the pan, scraping away any browned bits from cooking the sausage earlier.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C).

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Once cooked, remove the spinach and mushroom mixture from the pan and combine it with the reserved cooked sausage. Stir to mix evenly.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Combine eggs and milk. Lightly whisk until just combined.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Add sausage and spinach mixture to the bottom of a prepared 9-inch (23cm) pie crust, making sure to spread it evenly.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Pour in beaten eggs to fill the rest of the pie crust and top with a generous sprinkle of parmesan cheese.

tasks.title: Step 11
tasks.instruction: Bake at 350°F (180°C) for 25 minutes or until the eggs are set and the top is lightly browned. Allow to cool for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

tasks.title: Step 12
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

41dc1a814261f14a92a0634b136c34d6.title: Easy breakfast egg bites
41dc1a814261f14a92a0634b136c34d6.description: These protein-packed little egg bites are an excellent way to ensure everyone has a decent grab-and-go breakfast or a healthy snack. They will give you sustained energy throughout the morning and are super easy to make. Mix the ingredients, pour them into a muffin tin, and bake! They're also freezer-friendly, so you can make a big batch and have them on hand for those hectic mornings. And best of all, they only require simple ingredients that you probably already have in your kitchen.

ingredients.name: Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Hillshire Farm Sliced Honey Ham Deli Lunch Meat, 9 oz
Great Value Finely Shredded Mild Cheddar Cheese, 8 oz
Great Value Whole Vitamin D Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Cherubs Grape Tomatoes, 10 oz Package
Marketside Fresh Baby Spinach, 6 oz Bag, Fresh
ingredients.description: 1/2 cup packed Baby Spinach, coarsely chopped

ingredients.name: Fresh Green Onions Bunch, Each

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Spray a 12-well muffin tin with cooking spray.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: In a large bowl, whisk the eggs with the shredded cheese, milk, salt, and pepper, until combined.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Add the diced tomatoes, spinach, ham, and green onions. stir to combine.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Divide the mixture evenly among the muffin cups, about 1/4 cup in each cup.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Bake for 15-18 minutes, or until they are set, puffed, and turn light golden. They will deflate once removed from the oven, that’s totally normal.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Garnish with more green onions and serve warm.

1efab05f8c784f608562cbea86aa2db2.title: Sausage and broccoli rabe frittata
1efab05f8c784f608562cbea86aa2db2.description: As long as you’ve got an oven-safe skillet, this weeknight-friendly recipe requires zero fancy equipment. Plus, it barely dirties any dishes, since the whole thing is assembled in the same skillet it bakes in. Serve with a simple green salad, your favorite roasted veggies or a piece of crusty bread. Leftover slices can be stored in an airtight container (or wrapped tightly in foil) and refrigerated for up to four days.

ingredients.name: Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value All Natural Sour Cream, 8 oz Tub
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce
Great Value Finely Shredded Italian Style Cheese, 8 oz
Great Value Extra Virgin Olive Oil, 17 fl oz
Johnsonville Sweet Italian Sausage, 5 Links, 1 lb 3 oz (Fresh)
ingredients.description: 8 ounces uncooked sweet or spicy Italian sausage, casings removed

ingredients.name: Fresh Broccoli Crowns, Each
ingredients.description: 8 ounces broccoli rabe or broccoli, cut into 1-inch pieces

ingredients.name: Garlic Bulb, Each
ingredients.description: 2 cloves garlic, peeled and finely minced

ingredients.name: Great Value Grated Parmesan Cheese, 8 oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Preheat the oven to 350 F. Whisk the eggs, sour cream, black pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon of the salt in a large bowl. Add the fontina cheese and whisk to combine. Set aside.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a 10-inch ovenproof skillet (such as cast iron) over medium heat until shimmering. Add the sausage and cook, breaking it into smaller pieces with a wooden spoon, until browned and cooked through, 8 to 10 minutes. Transfer sausage to a paper towel-lined plate.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil and broccoli rabe to the skillet. Cook, stirring often, until the leaves are wilted and the stems are tender, 4 to 5 minutes. Add the garlic, cooked sausage, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Reduce the heat to medium-low. Pour the egg mixture into the skillet and gently shake the pan until the eggs are evenly distributed. Cook until the frittata is just set around the edges, 2 to 3 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Sprinkle the Parmesan cheese over the eggs and transfer the skillet to the oven. Bake until the center is just set, 18 to 22 minutes. Let sit for 5 minutes before slicing and serving.

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweet Cream Unsalted Butter, 16 oz
Great Value Whole Vitamin D Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz
ingredients.description: 2 cups whole milk, warm to the touch,2 tablespoons whole milk

ingredients.name: C&H Premium Pure Cane Granulated Sugar, 1 lb Box
Great Value Active Dry Yeast, 0.25 oz, 3 Count
King Arthur Flour Unbleached All-Purpose Flour 5 lb. Bag
Great Value Double Acting Baking Powder, 8.1 oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
Great Value Sweet Cream Salted Butter, 16 oz
ingredients.description: 3/4 cup butter, softened,2 tablespoons butter, melted

ingredients.name: Great Value Light Brown Sugar, 32 oz
Great Value Kosher Ground Cinnamon, 2.5 Oz
Great Value Cream Cheese, 8 oz
Great Value Pure Vanilla Extract, 1 fl oz
Great Value Confectioners Powdered Sugar, 32 oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Generously butter two disposable foil pie/cake pans.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In a large bowl, whisk together warm milk, melted butter, and granulated sugar. The mixture should be just warm, registering between 100-110°F (37-43°C). If it is hotter, allow to cool slightly.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Sprinkle the yeast evenly over the warm mixture and let set for 1 minute.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Add 4 cups (500g) of all-purpose flour to the milk mixture and mix with a wooden spoon until just combined.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Cover the bowl with a towel or plastic wrap and set in a warm place to rise for 1 hour.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: After 1 hour, the dough should have nearly doubled in size.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Remove the towel and add an additional ¾ cup (95g) of flour, the baking powder, and salt. Stir well, then turn out onto a well-floured surface.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Knead the dough lightly, adding additional flour as necessary, until the dough just loses its stickiness and does not stick to the surface.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Roll the dough out into a large rectangle, about 1/2-inch (1 cm) thick. Fix corners to make sure they are sharp and even.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Spread the softened butter evenly over the dough.

tasks.title: Step 11
tasks.instruction: Sprinkle evenly with brown sugar and a generous sprinkling of cinnamon.

tasks.title: Step 12
tasks.instruction: Press the mixture into the butter.

tasks.title: Step 13
tasks.instruction: Roll up the dough, forming a log, and pinch the seam closed. Place seam-side down. Trim off any unevenness on either end.

tasks.title: Step 14
tasks.instruction: Cut the log in half, then divide each half into 7 evenly sized pieces. About 1½ inches (8cm) thick each.

tasks.title: Step 15
tasks.instruction: Place 7 cinnamon rolls in each cake pan, one in the center, six around the sides. Cover with plastic wrap and place in a warm place to rise for 30 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 16
tasks.instruction: Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C).

tasks.title: Step 17
tasks.instruction: To prepare the frosting. In a medium-size mixing bowl, whisk together cream cheese, butter, whole milk, vanilla, and powdered sugar, until smooth.

tasks.title: Step 18
tasks.instruction: Remove plastic wrap. Bake the cinnamon rolls in a preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, until golden brown.

tasks.title: Step 19
tasks.instruction: While still warm, drizzle evenly with frosting.

tasks.title: Step 20
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

b6a1bcdd7417c421a4019dd3367738d6.title: Apple cinnamon baked oats
b6a1bcdd7417c421a4019dd3367738d6.description: Bake up a deliciously warm and filling breakfast with this Apple Cinnamon Baked Oats recipe. This breakfast treat is quick and easy to make, thanks to the microwave! If you like apple desserts, then you're going to love the cake-like texture of these oats.

ingredients.name: (6 Cups) Great Value Original Applesauce, 4 oz
Great Value 2% Reduced Fat Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz
ingredients.description: 1/2 cup milk or nondairy milk of your choice

ingredients.name: Great Value Organic Old Fashioned Oats 18oz
Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Maple Grove Farms Organic Pure Maple Syrup, 8.5 fl oz
Great Value Pure Vanilla Extract, 1 fl oz
Great Value Double Acting Baking Powder, 8.1 oz
Great Value Kosher Ground Cinnamon, 2.5 Oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
Gala Apples, Each

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Add the applesauce, milk, oats, eggs, maple syrup, vanilla, baking powder, and cinnamon to a blender. Blend for 1 minute, until smooth.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Divide the mixture between 4 ramekins.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: While the corn is roasting get the shells off of the Jumbo Shrimp (1 lb) , leaving the tails intact if desired.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Stir 1/4 of the apple into each ramekin.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Microwave for 3-5 minutes, or until the top of the oats are set and the side begin to pull away from the ramekin.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Using a pot holder, carefully remove the ramekins from the microwave (they will be very hot!) and let cool for 2-3 minutes before eating. Sprinkle with additional cinnamon, if desired.

a5a2e50abb744f8d6d03992a4da5ee4c.title: Avocado deviled eggs
a5a2e50abb744f8d6d03992a4da5ee4c.description: You'll love our Avocado Deviled Eggs if you're looking for a delicious appetizer that's quick and easy to make. We've taken the traditional deviled egg and given it a healthy twist by using avocado instead of mayonnaise. The result is a creamy, flavorful, and nutritious dish perfect for any occasion. Creamy avocado and crispy, smoky bacon create a delicious flavor that will have everyone coming back for more.

ingredients.name: Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value Real Bacon Pieces, 2.5 oz
ingredients.description: 1/4 cup Bacon Pieces, plus more for garnish

ingredients.name: Avocados, Each
Concord Foods Reconstituted Lime Juice, 4.5 oz
Garlic Bulb, Each
Great Value Dijon Mustard, 12 oz Squeeze Bottle
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
Lawry's Casero Cayenne Pepper, 1.62 oz
Fresh Cilantro, Bunch

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Bring a large pot of water to a boil, carefully place in the eggs, cook for 13 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Fish out the eggs and rinse them in cold water or place in ice water for 3 minutes. Peel and slice in half. Take out the yolks and set aside.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: In a food processor, add yolks, avocado, bacon, lime  juice, garlic, Dijon mustard, and salt. Blend until the filling is smooth.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Using a piping bag or a spoon, fill the egg whites with the avocado and yolk mixture. Top with more bacon pieces, and garnish with a sprinkle of cilantro (optional) and cayenne pepper (optional).

e1b2a4edaca0e1100441ec5557a05957.title: Giant blueberry pop tart
e1b2a4edaca0e1100441ec5557a05957.description: What could be better than a pop tart that you can slice up and share? It is perfect for potlucks, dinner parties or just for surprising friends. It is easy as pie to prepare, and much like a slab pie that’s baked  in a rimmed baking sheet, this has an ideal crust to filling ratio. After all, the crust is always the best part (and no, that’s not up for debate)!

ingredients.name: GV All Purpose Flour 2LB Bag
ingredients.description: 2 cups all-purpose flour, for dough,all-purpose flour, for rolling, for assembly

ingredients.name: C&H Premium Pure Cane Granulated Sugar, 1 lb Box
ingredients.description: 2 1/2 teaspoons granulated sugar, for dough,1 cup granulated sugar, for jam

ingredients.name: Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce
ingredients.description: 1 1/4 teaspoons kosher salt, for dough,1/8 teaspoon kosher salt, for jam

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweet Cream Unsalted Butter, 16 oz
ingredients.description: 1 1/2 sticks cold unsalted butter, diced, for dough

ingredients.name: Great Value Spring Water, 1 Gallon
Great Value Blueberries, 16 oz (Frozen)
Concord Foods Lemon Juice, 4.5 oz
ingredients.description: 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice, for jam,1 (to 2) teaspoons fresh lemon juice, for glaze

ingredients.name: Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
ingredients.description: 1 large egg, beaten with 1 teaspoon water, for assembly

ingredients.name: Great Value Confectioners Powdered Sugar, 32 oz
Great Value 2% Reduced Fat Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz
ingredients.description: 1 tablespoon milk, plus more as needed, for glaze

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweetened Dried Blueberries, 3.5 OZ
ingredients.description: 1 tablespoon finely ground freeze-dried blueberries, for glaze

ingredients.name: Great Value Patriotic Sprinkles Mix, 2.46 oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: MAKE THE DOUGH: In a large bowl, stir together flour, sugar and salt. Toss butter into dry mixture to evenly coat, then press between your fingers to create pea-size pieces of butter.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Slowly drizzle water over dough while stirring with a fork, just until mixture holds together when pinched between your fingers.3.Divide dough in half and shape each into a flat rectangle. Wrap in plastic and refrigerate until firm, at least 1 hour and up to 2 days.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: MAKE THE JAM: Combine blueberries, sugar, lemon juice and salt in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, stirring until sugar dissolves. Bring to a boil and cook, stirring often and mashing some of the berries with a fork or potato masher, until jam thickens (similar to the consistency of honey), 8 to 10 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Spoon jam into a heatproof bowl and let cool completely. Refrigerate until cold and set, at least 4 hours.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: TO ASSEMBLE: Roll out each piece of dough on a lightly floured surface into 12-by-9-inch rectangles.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Place one sheet of dough on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Spread blueberry jam evenly over dough, leaving a ½-inch border; brush border with egg wash. Top with the second sheet of dough, pressing edges to seal. Use the tines of a fork to crimp the edges. Refrigerate for 30 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Preheat the oven to 375 F. Brush top of dough all over with more egg wash, then prick the top all over with the fork. Bake until golden brown and bubbling in the center, 45 to 50 minutes. Let cool completely on a wire rack.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: MAKE THE GLAZE: In a medium bowl, whisk together powdered sugar, milk, lemon juice and freeze-dried berries until smooth and pourable (add more milk or water as needed to thin out).

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Spoon glaze over the top of the pastry, then top with sprinkles. Let glaze set for about 30 minutes before slicing and serving.

ingredients.name: Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Baker's Imitation Vanilla Flavor, 8 fl oz
Great Value 2% Reduced Fat Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz
Great Value Kosher Ground Cinnamon, 2.5 Oz
Maple Grove Farms Organic Pure Maple Syrup, 8.5 fl oz
Great Value Sweet Cream Salted Butter, 16 oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
Great Value Light Brown Sugar, 32 oz
Wonder Bread Classic Hot Dog Buns, White Bread Hot Dog Buns, 8 Count
Gala Apples, Each
Planters Mixed Nuts Less Than 50% Peanuts with Peanuts, Almonds, Cashews, Hazelnuts & Pecans, 10.3 oz Canister

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Whisk together eggs, milk, cinnamon, salt, vanilla, and brown sugar.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Add 3/4 of the grated apple to the egg mixture and fold it in.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Coat bread slices with the egg and apple mixture. Pan fry in butter on medium flame for about 1 minute on each side (or until nicely toasted).

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Serve with the remaining grated apple, crushed nuts and a drizzle of maple syrup.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Serve with the remaining grated apple, crushed nuts and a drizzle of maple syrup.

decc345b3aadfd793b2edf56a613461e.title: Best popovers
decc345b3aadfd793b2edf56a613461e.description: Popovers are an American version of Yorkshire Pudding, a popular British side dish that’s made with beef drippings, giving each airy bite a decidedly meaty flavor. Here, we use melted butter instead of the more traditional fat and specifically, salted butter so that you don’t need to worry about measuring and adding more salt to the batter.

ingredients.name: Great Value Salted Butter Sticks, 8 oz, 2 Sticks
ingredients.description: 3 tablespoons salted butter, melted and divided, for popovers,1 stick salted butter, softened, for maple butter

ingredients.name: Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
ingredients.description: 3 large eggs, room temperature, for popovers

ingredients.name: Great Value Whole Vitamin D Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz
ingredients.description: 1 1/4 cups whole milk, room temperature, for popovers

ingredients.name: GV All Purpose Flour 2LB Bag
Maple Grove Farms Organic Pure Maple Syrup, 8.5 fl oz
ingredients.description: 2 teaspoons pure maple syrup, for maple butter

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Preheat the oven to 450 F. Brush a 6-cup popover tin with 2 tablespoons melted butter. Place the tin in the oven to heat up while you make the batter.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In a 4-cup measuring glass, whisk eggs until the yolks and whites are completely homogenous and smooth, 1 to 2 minutes. Add butter and milk, and whisk to combine. Add flour and whisk until no lumps of flour remain.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Pour batter into the popover pan, filling each cup about 3/4 of the way. Place the popover pan on a baking sheet and transfer to the oven. Bake immediately for 20 minutes, then drop the temperature to 350 F and bake for an additional 12 to 14 minutes. Do not open the oven until they have finished baking completely.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: While the popovers bake, make the maple butter. In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, add the butter and maple syrup and beat until soft and fluffy, 1 to 2 minutes. Alternatively, you may use a hand mixer and glass bowl.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Once the popovers have finished baking, pull them from the oven and immediately cut a small slit in the top of each one to release the steam and help them keep their shape. Serve warm with a generous smear of maple butter.

af6dbac83840a35b6166ae3cbd4524e3.title: Tomato pesto frittata
af6dbac83840a35b6166ae3cbd4524e3.description: Here, pesto turns a ho-hum frittata into a bold, bright one. Whisking your favorite store-bought or homemade pesto with the usual eggs, milk, salt and pepper means you don’t even need to sautè any onions or garlic, or even add additional spices to flavor the frittata. Tomatoes join the party, too, since they’re pesto’s closest companion. They lend color and juicy sweetness to each slice. Top the whole thing off with grated Parmesan cheese to help brown the frittata and add extra cheesy, salty flavor.

ingredients.name: Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value Traditional Basil Pesto, 6.7 oz
ingredients.description: 1/4 cup basil pesto, store-bought or homemade, plus more for serving

ingredients.name: Great Value Whole Vitamin D Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz
Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Great Value Extra Virgin Olive Oil, 17 fl oz
Cherry Tomato, 10 oz Package
ingredients.description: 1 cup cherry or grape tomatoes, halved

ingredients.name: Great Value Grated Parmesan Cheese, 8 oz
ingredients.description: 1 ounce Parmesan cheese (1/2 cup firmly packed freshly grated or 1/3 cup store-bought grated)

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Arrange a rack in the top third of the oven and preheat the oven to 350 F.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Crack 8 large eggs into a large bowl and whisk until blended and smooth. Add 1/4 cup pesto, milk, salt and pepper and whisk to combine.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Heat the oil in a 10-inch cast iron or oven-safe nonstick skillet over medium heat until shimmering. Pour in the whisked eggs, tilting the pan to make sure the eggs spread out evenly to the edges of the pan. Scatter the tomatoes cut-side up all over the surface of the eggs and sprinkle the Parmesan over the top. Cook, undisturbed, until the eggs at the edges of the pan just begin to set, about 2 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake until the eggs are just set, 18 to 20 minutes. Pierce the center of the frittata with a paring knife: It should come out clean without any raw, wet egg. If not, continue to bake until it does.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Switch the oven to broil on high. Broil until the top of the frittata is golden-brown in spots, about 3 minutes. Let cool in the pan for at least 10 minutes. Slice into wedges and serve warm or at room temperature, garnished with a dollop of pesto.

6f8282357150ae8138da85837caa4a3e.title: Easy banana bread
6f8282357150ae8138da85837caa4a3e.description: This might be the easiest banana bread ever. You don’t need a stand mixer, numerous bowls or even a whisk to whip up this moist loaf. While most people love fresh banana bread, no one enjoys doing dishes (if you do, raise your hand. We have some questions). The entire recipe can be made using just one bowl and a fork (and a few measuring utensils).

ingredients.name: Crisco Pure Vegetable Oil, 16 fl oz
ingredients.description: 1/3 cup vegetable oil, plus more for pan

ingredients.name: Great Value Sliced Bananas, 16 oz (Frozen)
Great Value Light Brown Sugar, 32 oz
Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value Whole Vitamin D Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz
GV All Purpose Flour 2LB Bag
Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce
Great Value Double Acting Baking Powder, 8.1 oz
Great Value Baking Soda, 16 oz
Great Value Kosher Ground Cinnamon, 2.5 Oz
Great Value Chopped Walnuts, 8 oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Preheat the oven to 375 F. Brush a 9-by-5-inch loaf pan with oil and line with parchment paper, leaving an overhang on the two long sides.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Use a fork to mash bananas in a large bowl. Add brown sugar, eggs, milk, and oil and whisk with the fork to combine. Add flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, and cinnamon and mix until fully incorporated. Fold in walnuts, if using.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Pour batter into the prepared pan. Bake until the top of the loaf is golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out mostly clean, 55 to 60 minutes. Cool for 20 minutes, then lift the bread from the pan and transfer to a wire rack to cool completely, about 1 hour.

4e418cdb5814239cd6a4e8a16ea75132.title: Salted honey apple brie grilled cheese
4e418cdb5814239cd6a4e8a16ea75132.description: Salted Honey Apple Brie Grilled Cheese

ingredients.name: Granny Smith Apples, Each
ingredients.description: 1 granny smith apple, halved, cored, and sliced 1/8 – 1/4 - inch-thick

ingredients.name: Morton Sea Salt, Fine, 4.4 Ounce
Oroweat Whole Grains Small Slice Oatnut Bread, Free from Artificial Preservatives 18 Ounces
ingredients.description: 4 slices fruit and nut bread, or rustic bread of choice

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweet Cream Unsalted Butter, 16 oz
Great Value Organic Strained Raw Honey, 12 oz Inverted Plastic Bottle
President Brie Soft-Ripened Cheese, 8 oz
ingredients.description: 8 oz brie cheese, rind removed and sliced

ingredients.name: Great Value Dijon Mustard, 12 oz Squeeze Bottle

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Heat a large griddle or skillet over medium-low heat.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Spread the butter on one side of each slice of bread. Flip the bread over and spread the mustard on 2 slices, then layer the apple slices on top of the mustard. Drizzle the honey over the apples, then sprinkle with a pinch of flaky salt. Arrange the Brie on the other slices of bread. Close the sandwiches.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Transfer the sandwiches to the pan and cook until golden brown on each side and the cheese has melted, 7–9 minutes per side.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Remove the sandwiches from the pan and cut in half. Top with another drizzle of honey and a sprinkle of flaky salt. Serve immediately.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: King Arthur Flour Unbleached All-Purpose Flour 5 lb. Bag
Great Value Sugar Cannister 20oz
Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce
Great Value Double Acting Baking Powder, 8.1 oz
Great Value Baking Soda, 16 oz
Crystal Creamery Old World Style Bulgarian Cultured Buttermilk, 1 Quart
Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value Sweet Cream Unsalted Butter, 16 oz
ingredients.description: 3 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted,1/2 teaspoon unsalted butter, plus more to serve

ingredients.name: Maple Grove Farms Organic Pure Maple Syrup, 8.5 fl oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: In a bowl, add the flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, and baking soda, and whisk to combine.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In a bowl or measuring cup, whisk the buttermilk, eggs, and melted butter until smooth.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Add the buttermilk mixture to the dry ingredients, gently incorporating with a spatula. Make sure not to overmix, as that will result in dense pancakes

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Add the butter to a pan over medium low heat. Once the butter begins to bubble, add 1/3 cup (80 ml) of batter to the pan.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Cook until the top side begins to bubble and the bottom is golden brown. Flip the pancake and cook until the underside is golden brown. Repeat with the remaining batter.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: King Arthur Flour Unbleached All-Purpose Flour 5 lb. Bag
Great Value Organic Granulated Cane Sugar, 2 Lb
Great Value Double Acting Baking Powder, 8.1 oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
Great Value Original Unsweetened Almond Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz
Great Value Apple Cider Vinegar, 32 fl oz
Baker's Imitation Vanilla Flavor, 8 fl oz
Maple Grove Farms Organic Pure Maple Syrup, 8.5 fl oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: In a medium bowl, add the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt, and stir to combine.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In a medium bowl or liquid measuring cup, add almond milk, apple cider vinegar, and vanilla, and stir to combine

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Pour the liquid mixture into the dry mixture and whisk until smooth.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Let batter rest for 5 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Pour about 1/2 cup (65 grams) of batter onto a nonstick pan or griddle over medium heat.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: When the top begins to bubble, flip the pancake and cook until golden.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Serve warm with maple syrup.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
ingredients.description: 2 tablespoons salt, for water,1 teaspoon salt

ingredients.name: Russet Potatoes, 5 lb Bag
ingredients.description: 2 lb potato, cut into 1-inch (2 cm) cubes

ingredients.name: Crisco Pure Vegetable Oil, 16 fl oz
Yellow Onions, Each
Garlic Bulb, Each
El Guapo Whole Cumin (Comino Entero), 0.75 oz
Lawry's Casero Cayenne Pepper, 1.62 oz
Lawry's Casero Curry Powder, 1.75 oz
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Fresh Ginger Root, Each

Bush's Garbanzo Beans, Canned Chickpeas, 16 oz Can
Great Value Canned Sweet Peas, 15 oz Can
Thai Kitchen Gluten Free Lite Coconut Milk

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Place potatoes into a large pot or dutch oven and cover with well-salted water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to a simmer, cover and let the potatoes cook until fork tender–about 12 minutes. Once cooked, drain the potatoes and set them aside.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Return the pot to the stove and add 1 tablespoon of oil. Add onion and garlic and sauté over medium heat until onion is tender and starts to turn translucent, about 3-5 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Add cumin, cayenne, curry powder, salt, pepper and ginger. Stir to combine before adding tomatoes, chickpeas, and peas.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Increase heat to medium-high and stir in the coconut milk. Bring to a simmer before adding the potatoes back to the pot. Reduce heat to low and cook everything together for 3-5 minutes before serving.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Foster Farms Fresh & Natural Boneless & Skinless Chicken Breast Fillets, 1.6 - 2.39 lb
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Great Value Frozen Broccoli Florets, 12 oz Steamable Bag
Fresh Whole White Mushrooms, 8 oz
Great Value Classic Olive Oil, 17 fl oz
Garlic Bulb, Each
Fresh Ginger Root, Each
Imperial Dragon 100% Pure Sesame Seed Oil, 5 fl oz
Great Value Less Sodium Soy Sauce, 15 fl oz
Great Value Light Brown Sugar, 32 oz
Great Value Chicken Broth, 14.5 oz Can
King Arthur Flour Unbleached All-Purpose Flour 5 lb. Bag

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: In a large pan on medium-high heat, add 1 tablespoon of oil. Once the oil is hot, add chicken, season with salt and pepper, and sauté until cooked through and browned. Remove cooked chicken from pan and set aside.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In the same pan, heat 1 tablespoon of oil and add mushrooms. When the mushrooms start to soften, add broccoli florets and stir-fry until the broccoli is tender. Remove cooked mushrooms and broccoli from the pan and set aside.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Add 1 tablespoon of oil to the pan and sauté garlic and ginger until fragrant. Add the remaining sauce ingredients and stir until smooth.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Return the chicken and vegetables to the saucy pan, stir until heated through.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Serve with hot rice or noodles.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Russet Baking Potatoes, Each
Great Value Classic Olive Oil, 17 fl oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Great Value Garlic Powder, 3.4 oz
Great Value Oregano Leaves, 0.87 oz
Great Value Paprika, 2.5 oz
Frigo Shredded Parmesan Cheese, 10 oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Thoroughly wash potatoes, cut in half, and slice into wedges.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Toss wedges in olive oil and seasonings.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Place on a baking sheet, skin side down.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Bake 40-50 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweet Cream Salted Butter, 16 oz
Garlic Bulb, Each
King Arthur Flour Unbleached All-Purpose Flour 5 lb. Bag
Great Value 2% Reduced Fat Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Baby Yellow Potatoes, 1.5 lb Bag
Great Value Finely Shredded Parmesan Cheese, 6 oz
Fresh Curly Parsley Bunch, Each

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C).

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In a small pot, melt the butter and fry the garlic until it’s just starting to brown. Add the flour, salt and pepper. whisk until there are no lumps.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Slowly drizzle in the milk while constantly whisking to make sure the mixture is smooth.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Bring to a boil, then remove from heat.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Slice the potatoes into about 1/8-inch (3 mm) thick slices, then fan them out in a small baking dish.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Pour the sauce on top of the potatoes, then sprinkle with parmesan.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Bake for about 1 hour, until the top is bubbly and golden brown.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Sprinkle chopped parsley on top, then serve.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Foster Farms Fresh & Natural Cage Free Family Pack Chicken Thighs 64 -88 oz (4-5.5 lb) Tray
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Great Value Paprika, 2.5 oz
Fresh Curly Parsley Bunch, Each
Great Value Classic Olive Oil, 17 fl oz
Garlic Bulb, Each
Fresh Red Onions, Each
Great Value Long Grain Enriched Rice, 32 oz
Great Value Chicken Broth, 14.5 oz Can

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In a large bowl, evenly season chicken thighs with salt, pepper, paprika, and parsley.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: On high, heat olive oil in a oven-proof pot and place chicken thighs, skin-side down, in the hot oil. Cook 5-6 minutes or the thighs develop brown crispy skin and flip over.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Cook an additional 5-6 minutes to brown the other side and remove from the pot.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Add the garlic and onions to the pot, and cook until the onions are transparent.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Pour in the rice and chicken broth to the pot and season with salt and pepper. Stir well, bringing to a boil.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Add the chicken thighs back into the pot, skin-side up, on top of the rice, bring back to a boil and cover with a lid.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the rice is fully cooked.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: NOTE: For a crispy skin, remove chicken thighs and broil.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: All Natural* 73% Lean/27% Fat Ground Beef, 1 lb, Roll
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Great Value Hamburger Buns, 8 Count, 11 oz
Great Value Singles American Pasteurized Prepared Cheese Product, 12 oz, 16 Count
Great Value Mayonnaise, 15 fl oz
Great Value Sweet Gherkins, 16 oz

Great Value Yellow Mustard, 8 oz
