Great Value Onion Powder, 3.25 oz
Lawry's Casero Smoked Paprika, 2 oz
Great Value Organic Ground White Pepper, 2.05 oz
Yellow Onions, Each
Fresh Iceberg Lettuce, Each

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Roll half of the beef mince into a ball and pat it down until a finger thick, bigger than palm size patty. Repeat with remaining beef

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Fry both patties with salt and pepper for 2 and a half minutes a side.Add 1 cheese single to one of the patties.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Toast the burger buns on a dry pan on medium heat until one of the sides is golden brown.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Mix all the sauce ingredients and set aside.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Time to build this bad boy! Spread burger sauce on a bun, sprinkle diced onion, shredded lettuce, place the patty with cheese, place another slice of bun.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Then more sauce, more onion, shredded lettuce, gherkin slices, another patty, and the last slice of bun!

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Dig in and get lovin’ it!

d7811eb2821f74697625f451857cccff.title: Sheet-pan pork chops, apple, & cabbage dinner
d7811eb2821f74697625f451857cccff.description: Sheet-Pan Pork Chops, Apple, & Cabbage Dinner

ingredients.name: Great Value Canola Oil Non-Stick Cooking Spray, 8 oz
Fresh Green Cabbage, Each
ingredients.description: 1 small head green cabbage, cut into 2-inch (5 cm) pieces

ingredients.name: Gala Apples, Each
ingredients.description: 2 medium gala apples, cut into wedges

ingredients.name: Great Value Honey Mustard Dressing & Dip, 16 fl oz
Pork Center Cut Loin Chops Bone-In, 1.6 - 2.6 lb, Tray
ingredients.description: 2 bone in pork chops, about 1 in (2.5 cm) thick

ingredients.name: Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C) and grease a baking sheet with nonstick spray.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In a large bowl, toss the cabbage, fennel, and apples with ½ cup (120 ml) Club House La Grille Honey & Dijon 30 Minute Marinade. Spread in an even layer on the prepared baking sheet.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Season the pork chops on both sides with the salt and pepper. Using a pastry brush, brush the remaining ¼ cup (60 ml) marinade over both sides of the pork chops. Transfer to the baking sheet with the cabbage mixture.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Roast for 28–30 minutes, tossing the vegetables halfway through, until the pork reaches an internal temperature of 145°F (63°C) and the vegetables are crisp-tender. Serve immediately.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweet Cream Unsalted Butter, 16 oz
Garlic Bulb, Each
Great Value Chicken Broth, 14.5 oz Can
Great Value 2% Reduced Fat Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz
Great Value Fettuccine, 16 oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Great Value Finely Shredded Parmesan Cheese, 6 oz
Fresh Curly Parsley Bunch, Each

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Heat unsalted butter in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add garlic and cook, stirring frequently, until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Add in the chicken broth, milk, and fettuccine. Season with salt and pepper.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Bring the pot to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, until pasta is cooked through, about 18-20 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Stir in Parmesan. If the mixture is too thick, add more milk as needed until desired consistency is reached.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Serve immediately, and top with parsley.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Fresh Purple Eggplant, Each
Fresh Roma Tomato, Each
Fresh Yellow Squash, Each
Fresh Zucchini Squash, Each
Great Value Classic Olive Oil, 17 fl oz
ingredients.description: 2 tablespoons olive oil, for sauce,4 tablespoons olive oil

ingredients.name: Yellow Onions, Each
Garlic Bulb, Each
ingredients.description: 4 cloves garlic, minced, for sauce,1 teaspoon garlic, minced, for herb seasoning

ingredients.name: Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
ingredients.description: salt, to taste, for sauce,salt, to taste, for herb seasoning

ingredients.name: McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
ingredients.description: pepper, to taste, for sauce,pepper, to taste, for herb seasoning

ingredients.name: Great Value Crushed Tomatoes with Tomato Puree, 28 Oz
ingredients.description: 28 oz can of crushed tomatoes, for sauce

ingredients.name: Shenandoah Growers Organic Fresh Potted Basil, 1 Each
ingredients.description: 2 tablespoons chopped fresh basil, from 8-10 leaves, for sauce

ingredients.name: Fresh Curly Parsley Bunch, Each
ingredients.description: 2 tablespoons Chopped fresh parsley, for herb seasoning

ingredients.name: Mariposa Farms Fresh Cut Thyme, .75 oz

ingredients.description: 1 yellow bell pepper, diced, for sauce
1 red bell pepper, diced, for sauce

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Preheat the oven for 375°F (190°C).

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Slice the eggplant, tomatoes, squash, and zucchini into approximately 1/16-inch (1-mm) rounds, then set aside.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Make the sauce: Heat the olive oil in a 12-inch (30-cm) oven-safe pan over medium-high heat. Sauté the onion, garlic, and bell peppers until soft, about 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, then add the crushed tomatoes. Stir until the ingredients are fully incorporated. Remove from heat, then add the basil. Stir once more, then smooth the surface of the sauce with a spatula.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Arrange the sliced veggies in alternating patterns, (for example, eggplant, tomato, squash, zucchini) on top of the sauce from the outer edge to the middle of the pan. Season with salt and pepper.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Make the herb seasoning: In a small bowl, mix together the basil, garlic, parsley, thyme, salt, pepper, and olive oil. Spoon the herb seasoning over the vegetables.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Cover the pan with foil and bake for 40 minutes. Uncover, then bake for another 20 minutes, until the vegetables are softened.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Serve while hot as a main dish or side. The ratatouille is also excellent the next day--cover with foil and reheat in a 350°F (180°C) oven for 15 minutes, or simply microwave to desired temperature.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Great Value Canola Oil, 48 fl oz
Freshness Guaranteed Thin-Sliced Chicken Breasts, 1.7 - 3.0 lb
ingredients.description: 2 chicken breasts, sliced into 1/2 inch (2cm) strips

ingredients.name: Garlic Bulb, Each
Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Great Value Heavy Whipping Cream, 16 Oz
Great Value Finely Shredded Parmesan Cheese, 6 oz
ingredients.description: 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese,parmesan cheese, to garnish

ingredients.name: Prego Basil Pesto Sauce, 8 Oz Jar
Great Value Penne Pasta, 16 oz
ingredients.description: 3 cups penne pasta, cooked and drained

ingredients.name: Cherry Tomato, 10 oz Package
Shenandoah Growers Organic Fresh Potted Basil, 1 Each

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Heat the oil in a pan over high heat. Combine the chicken, garlic, salt, and pepper, cooking until chicken is browned.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Then, mix in the heavy cream, parmesan, and pesto, stirring until evenly combined.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Next, bring to a boil and cook until the sauce has reduced, about five to seven minutes.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Toss in the pasta and cherry tomatoes, stirring until evenly coated. Remove from heat.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: To serve, sprinkle parmesan cheese and basil on top!

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Great Value All Natural Boneless Skinless Chicken Breasts, 3 lb (Frozen)
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Great Value Garlic Powder, 3.4 oz
Great Value Onion Powder, 3.25 oz
Great Value Gluten Free Deli Style Sliced Swiss Cheese, 16 oz, 24 Count
Hillshire Farm Sliced Honey Ham Deli Lunch Meat, 9 oz
Great Value Peanut Oil, 1 Gal
ingredients.description: peanut oil, or vegetable oil, for frying

ingredients.name: King Arthur Flour Unbleached All-Purpose Flour 5 lb. Bag
ingredients.description: 1 cup all-purpose flour,3 tablespoons all-purpose flour

ingredients.name: Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value Plain Panko Bread Crumbs, 8 oz
Great Value Sweet Cream Salted Butter, 16 oz
Garlic Bulb, Each
Great Value 2% Reduced Fat Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz
Great Value Dijon Mustard, 12 oz Squeeze Bottle
Great Value Grated Parmesan Cheese, 8 oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Sprinkle the chicken breasts with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder, tossing to coat evenly.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: On a cutting board, place a chicken breast between two sheets of plastic wrap and pound until about 1/2 inch (1 cm) thick with a meat mallet, rolling pin, or heavy pan.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Remove the plastic wrap and place 2 slices of Swiss cheese, then 2 slices of ham, then another layer of Swiss cheese, and another layer of ham. Evenly roll the chicken and place onto a new sheet of plastic wrap.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Wrap the chicken in the plastic wrap tightly and use the excess plastic on the sides to twist, firming up the roll of chicken cordon bleu as you work. Tie the excess plastic. Repeat with the remaining ingredients, then chill the rolls in the fridge to set for 30 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Meanwhile, preheat a tall-sided pan with 2 inches (5 cm) of oil to 325°F (170°C).

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: After the rolls are set, prepare 2 separate large, wide dishes with the flour, beaten egg, and bread crumbs. Dredge the chicken first in the flour, then the egg, and then bread crumbs.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Place the breaded chicken cordon bleu in the oil and cook for about 5 minutes per side, or until the outside is an even golden brown. If a good color is achieved and the chicken’s center is still not 165°F (75°C), place the chicken cordon bleu on a wire rack set over a baking sheet and finish the chicken in the oven at 325°F (170°C) until that temperature is reached.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Meanwhile, prepare the sauce. In a 1 1/2-quart saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter and cook the garlic until soft. Add the flour and whisk for 1 minute.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Add the milk and whisk until fully combined with the roux and no lumps remain. Continue whisking until the mixture comes to a simmer and has thickened.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Add the mustard, Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper and whisk to combine. Remove the pan from the heat.

tasks.title: Step 11
tasks.instruction: Slice the chicken and serve drizzled with Dijon sauce.

tasks.title: Step 12
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Foster Farms Fresh & Natural Cage Free Family Pack Chicken Thighs 64 -88 oz (4-5.5 lb) Tray
ingredients.description: 2 lb boneless, skinless chicken thighs, pounded flat

ingredients.name: Yellow Onions, Each
ingredients.description: 1/2 large yellow onion, peeled and root side removed

ingredients.name: GoodCook ProFreshionals 10" Bamboo Skewers for BBQ and Kebab 100-count, Natural
ingredients.description: 1 wooden skewer, sturdy, roughly 10 inches (25 cm)

ingredients.name: Great Value Light Greek Vanilla Nonfat Yogurt, 32 oz
ingredients.description: 2 cups greek yogurt  for marinade,2 cups greek yogurt for tzatziki sauce

ingredients.name: Concord Foods Lemon Juice, 4.5 oz
Great Value Classic Olive Oil, 17 fl oz
Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: In a large bowl, combine marinade ingredients and stir well.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: On a cutting board, place a piece of plastic wrap over the chicken thighs and pound until about 1/2 inch (1 cm) thick with a meat mallet, rolling pin, or heavy pan.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: In another large bowl or gallon plastic bag, combine chicken thighs and marinade, stirring well to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least one hour and up to one day.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Shred the cucumber, be sure to squeeze out any excess liquid.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: In a medium bowl, combine tzatziki ingredients and stir well. Cover and refrigerate at least 30 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: On a baking sheet or a large cast-iron skillet, use the onion half as a base and position the skewer vertically like a spit. Skewer the chicken thighs individually, rotating each one 90 degrees.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Bake for 1.5 to 2 hours, until internal temperature reaches 165°F (75°C). Let cool for 10 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Carve off slices of chicken to fill a pita. Top with onion slices, tomato slices, and tzatziki sauce.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: On a cutting board, cut chicken into 1x1-inch (2x2-cm) cubes and set aside.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In a medium mixing bowl, combine salt, white pepper, cornstarch, and flour. Whisk to combine.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Add the egg, water, and oil until it reaches the consistency of pancake batter.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Add the chicken to the batter and refrigerate at least 30 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Heat oil in a wok or heavy bottom pan to 350°F (180°C).

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Gently add the chicken and cook for 5-6 minutes until lightly golden brown.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Remove the chicken from the pan and transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Set a heavy bottomed pot over medium- high heat and add the oil.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the red pepper flakes, ginger, and garlic, and cook for 30 seconds, stirring constantly.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Add the sugar and brown sugar, and stir to combine.

tasks.title: Step 11
tasks.instruction: Add in the orange juice and allow the sugars to begin to dissolve in the liquid, stirring occasionally.

tasks.title: Step 12
tasks.instruction: Add in the vinegar and soy sauce, and stir to combine.

tasks.title: Step 13
tasks.instruction: Add the cornstarch and water together and whisk to combine. Add to the pan and stir.

tasks.title: Step 14
tasks.instruction: Continue to cook the sauce until maple syrup consistency is achieved.

tasks.title: Step 15
tasks.instruction: Add in the fried chicken and stir until completely coated in the sauce.

tasks.title: Step 16
tasks.instruction: Top with sesame oil.

tasks.title: Step 17
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: To clean the chicken, rub all over with a handful of kosher salt, getting rid of any loose skin. Rinse the chicken well inside and out. Pat dry with paper towels.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Remove any excess fat from the chicken and set aside for later.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Season the chicken generously with salt. Stuff the chicken cavity with the ginger slices and scallions.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Place the chicken in a large stock pot, cover with cold water by 1 inch (2 cm), and season with salt to taste.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Bring to a boil over high heat, then immediately reduce the heat to low to maintain a simmer. Cover and cook for about 30 minutes, or until the internal temperature of the chicken reaches 165°F (75°C). Remove the pot from the heat.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Remove the chicken from the pot, reserving the poaching liquid for later, and transfer to an ice bath for 5 minutes to stop the cooking process and to keep the chicken skin springy. Discard the ginger and green onion.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: After it’s cooled, pat the chicken dry with paper towels and rub all over with sesame oil. This will help prevent the chicken from drying out.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: In a large wok or skillet, heat 1/4 cup (60 ml) of sesame oil over medium-high heat. Add 2 tablespoons of reserved chopped chicken fat, the garlic, ginger, and salt, and fry until aromatic, about 10 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Reserve 1/4 of the fried garlic mixture, then add the rice to the remaining fried garlic and stir to coat. Cook for 3 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Transfer the rice to a rice cooker and add 2 cups (480 ml) of reserved poaching broth. Steam the rice for 60 minutes, or until tender.

tasks.title: Step 11
tasks.instruction: While the rice is cooking, carve the chicken for serving.

tasks.title: Step 12
tasks.instruction: Make the chili sauce: combine the sambal, Sriracha, sugar, garlic, ginger, lime juice, and chicken broth in a small bowl and stir to incorporate.

tasks.title: Step 13
tasks.instruction: Make the ginger garlic sauce: in a small bowl, combine the ginger, garlic, salt, peanut oil, and rice vinegar, and stir to incorporate.

tasks.title: Step 14
tasks.instruction: Make the soy sauce: in a small bowl, combine the reserved fried garlic and ginger with the oyster sauce, dark soy sauce, light soy sauce, and chicken broth, and stir to incorporate.

tasks.title: Step 15
tasks.instruction: Serve the sliced chicken with the rice, dipping sauces, sliced cucumbers, and fresh cilantro.

tasks.title: Step 16
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

tasks.instruction: Combine the beef, salt, pepper, and garlic powder in a 9x13-inch (23x33-cm) rimmed baking dish, mixing thoroughly, then pressing into a flat, even layer. Bake for 20 minutes. Drain the liquid and set the cooked beef aside.

tasks.title: Step 3

tasks.title: Step 4

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: On a cutting board, peel the potatoes. Place the potatoes in a large bowl of cold water after peeling to avoid discoloration.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Cut the potatoes into 1-inch (2 cm) cubes.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Add the potatoes to a large pot and cover with cold water. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 12 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: In a small saucepan, bring the milk, heavy cream, and garlic to a simmer over low heat.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Remove the pot from the heat and strain the cream through a fine mesh sieve.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Drain the potatoes in a colander and transfer back to the pot.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Mash the potatoes with a potato masher, potato ricer, or by pushing through a fine mesh sieve with a spatula.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Add the cubed cold butter and salt. Stir to combine.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Gradually add the cream mixture to the potatoes, little by little, until fully incorporated.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Top with freshly ground black pepper and sprinkle with chives and serve.

tasks.title: Step 11
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.description: 1 lb boneless pork shoulder, cut into 1-inch (2-cm) cubes, for chicharron

ingredients.description: 1 teaspoon salt, for chicharron,2 teaspoons salt, for pupusa dough

ingredients.name: Fresh Roma Tomato, Each
Fresh Green Bell Pepper, Each
ingredients.description: 1/2 green bell pepper, diced, for chicharron

ingredients.name: Quaker Masa Harina de Maiz Corn Tortilla Mix 70.4 oz. Bag
ingredients.description: 4 cups masa harina, for pupusa dough

ingredients.name: Great Value Finely Shredded Low-Moisture Part-Skim Mozzarella Cheese, 8 oz
ingredients.description: 1 cup grated mozzarella cheese, for filling

ingredients.name: Great Value Traditional Refried Beans, 16 Oz
ingredients.description: 1 cup refried bean, cooked, for filling

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Make the curtido: In a large bowl, combine the cabbage, onion, and carrots. Pour the boiling water over the vegetables and toss. Let sit for 10 minutes, then drain.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In a liquid measuring cup or small bowl, combine the vinegar, oregano, and salt. Pour over the slaw and toss to coat. Once thoroughly mixed, transfer the curtido any any leftover liquid in the bowl to an airtight jar or container.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Chill for at least 20 minutes in the refrigerator, or chill overnight for best results.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Make the chicharrón: Heat the vegetable oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add the pork shoulder and salt. Cook for 15 minutes without disturbing. If the pork is browning too quickly, reduce the heat to medium. Turn the pork over and let cook on the other side for 10 minutes more, or until crispy and golden brown.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Transfer the pork to a food processor and add the tomato, green bell pepper, and onion. Pulse until a thick paste forms. The mixture should not be watery. Set aside.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Make the pupusa dough: In a large bowl, whisk together the masa harina and salt, then add the water. Use your hands to mix until the dough comes together with a clay-like texture.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Fill a small bowl with water and a bit of oil and set near your work station. You’ll wet your fingers with the mixture as you work to keep the dough from sticking to your hands.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Take a golf ball-sized portion of dough and roll into a ball, then flatten into an even round.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Fill the dough round with ½ tablespoon chicharrón paste, 1 teaspoon refried beans, and 1 teaspoon mozzarella cheese. Fold the dough over the filling until it’s completely sealed. Then, pat out the ball between your hands until flat. If the pupusa cracks, patch it with a bit of dough and a little oil. Repeat with the remaining ingredients.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Heat a large pan or griddle over medium heat. Brush with vegetable oil, then place 2-3 pupusas on the pan and cook for 2-4 minutes, or until the bottoms are golden brown. Flip and cook on the other side for 2-4 minutes more, until golden brown and warmed through. Repeat with the remaining pupusas.

tasks.title: Step 11
tasks.instruction: Serve the pupusas with curtido.

tasks.title: Step 12
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Slice the pork shoulder into about 1-centimeter (¼ in) slices, then transfer to a large dish or bowl. In a medium bowl, combine the achiote paste, chili powder, garlic powder, oregano, cumin, salt, pepper, vinegar, and pineapple juice, mashing and stirring until smooth with no lumps. Pour the marinade over the pork slices, then toss to make sure they are coated on all sides. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, then refrigerate for at least 2 hours or up to 3 days.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Place a slice or two of the pineapple on the baking sheet. Take a wooden skewer and push it directly in the middle of the pineapple. Remove the pork from the fridge and push the slices through the skewer, layering one after the other until there is a 1-inch (2 ½ cm) gap at the top. Push another pineapple slice on top.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Bake for about 1½ hours, until the pork is slightly charred on the outside and deep red. Rest the meat for about 10 minutes, then carve off thin slices of pork and roasted pineapple.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: To assemble, place some pork on the tortillas, followed by a few pieces of pineapple, a sprinkling of onion, a pinch of cilantro, and a spoonful of salsa, and some diced avocado. Serve with lime wedges.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

tasks.instruction: Place the chicken thighs skin side down in the skillet and cook for about 13 minutes to crisp up the skin. Move the chicken around from time to time to ensure it cooks evenly. The skin should be hard to the touch.

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Add the stock to a medium pot and bring to a boil over high heat. Once the stock is boiling, reduce the heat to low or remove the pan from the heat and keep nearby.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Heat the olive oil in a wide, tall pot over medium heat. Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the shallot and cook, stirring frequently, until translucent.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Add the shiitake mushrooms and butter. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the mushrooms have cooked down.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Add the garlic, thyme, salt, and pepper, stir, and cook for 1 minute, until the butter has melted and the garlic is aromatic.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Add the rice and stir until fully coated in the mushroom mixture. Let the rice toast for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Add the white wine and cook until the wine has evaporated, stirring occasionally.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Add 1 cup (240 ml) of the hot stock and stir to combine. Cook, stirring frequently, until the stock is fully absorbed.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Continue to add the stock, 1/2 cup (120 ml) at a time, stirring continuously, until the broth is fully absorbed, for 15-20 minutes. Depending on how fast the rice cooks, there may be leftover stock.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Once the rice is al dente, remove from the heat. Add the Parmesan and stir to combine.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Top with parsley, Parmesan, salt, and pepper.

tasks.title: Step 11
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Heat oil in a large pot over high heat

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Add chicken and cook until no pink is visible, about 5-6 minutes, then take the chicken out.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Add the bell peppers and onion, cooking until the onion is translucent, about 6 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Add the chicken back to the pot with salt, pepper, chili powder, cumin, and garlic powder, stirring until evenly coated, about 30 seconds.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Add the milk and the penne, stirring constantly to prevent any pasta from sticking.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Cook for about 20 minutes until pasta is cooked and the milk has reduced to a thick sauce that coats the pasta.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Add the cheese and mix until melted.

tasks.title: Step 8

Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
ingredients.description: 1 teaspoon salt, plus more for the water

Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
King Arthur Flour Unbleached All-Purpose Flour 5 lb. Bag
ingredients.description: 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, extra to dust

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweet Cream Salted Butter, 16 oz
Sage Fresh Cut .75oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Add the potatoes to a large pot of cool salted water. Bring the water to a boil and cook for 20-25 minutes, or until a fork can easily pierce a potato. Drain the potatoes and set aside until cool enough to handle but still warm.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Using a peeler or your fingers, remove the skin from the potatoes. In a medium bowl, mash the potatoes until all lumps are gone. Add the salt and pepper and mix well. Make a well in the center of the potatoes and crack an egg into it. Whisk the eggs briefly. Then, using your hands, gently mix it into the potatoes until evenly distributed.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Put 1 cups of flour onto a clean surface and turn out the potato dough onto it, keeping the remaining 1/2 cup close by in case you need it. Working quickly and carefully, knead the dough, only incorporating as much flour as you need along the way until the dough loses stickiness and becomes more solid. Slice the dough into 4 parts. Roll out 1 part into a long rope, about 1 inch wide, cutting in half and working with 1 half at a time if the rope is becoming too long. Slice the rope into 1/2-inch squares and set aside on a lightly floured surface. Repeat with the remaining dough.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: If desired, place a fork on your work surface and slide each gnocchi square from the base of the fork prongs to the top so they make a decorative shape.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and add the gnocchi in batches, stirring gently once or twice to ensure they are not sticking. Boil until they float to the surface; after another 15-30 seconds in the water, remove.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: In a pan over medium heat, melt butter and add the sage. Add the gnocchi and toss until lightly golden.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Great Value Spring Water, 1 Gallon
Great Value Active Dry Yeast, 0.25 oz, 3 Count
King Arthur Flour Unbleached All-Purpose Flour 5 lb. Bag
ingredients.description: 4 cups all-purpose flour, lightly packed and leveled off, plus more for dusting

ingredients.name: Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce
Great Value Classic Olive Oil, 17 fl oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Stir the yeast into the water and allow the yeast to bloom until foamy.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In a large bowl, mix together the flour and salt by hand. Once incorporated, create a small well in the middle and pour in the water and yeast mixture.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Mix by hand, wetting your working hand before mixing so the dough doesn’t stick to your fingers. The water and flour should come together and a form rough dough that pulls away from the sides of the bowl. If the dough is too sticky, add more flour in small increments, about 1 tablespoon at a time. If the dough is too dry, add more water, 1 tablespoon at a time.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Once the dough comes together, cover and let rise until doubled in size (about 1 ½-2 hours).

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Uncover the dough and give it a few pokes with your finger. If the dough has risen properly, it should indent under the pressure of your finger and slowly deflate.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Using your hand or a rubber spatula, start from the rim of the bowl to work the dough loose from the sides and fold it up and towards the center of the bowl. Turn the bowl 90 degrees, and repeat until all the dough has been pulled from the sides and folded towards the center.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Once finished, cover and let the dough rise again for another 1 1/2-2 hours.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Once the dough has doubled in size again, gently transfer it from the bowl to a lightly floured surface.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Sprinkle a bit of flour on top of the dough. Using your hands, begin to shape it into a loaf. Fold the dough under itself several times to form a ball, then pinch together the seams of dough underneath.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Place the dough seam-side down in a clean bowl that has been lightly coated with olive oil and dusted with flour.

tasks.title: Step 11
tasks.instruction: Cover and let rise for 1 hour.

tasks.title: Step 12
tasks.instruction: Meanwhile, place a 6-quart Dutch oven (or heavy cooking pot with oven-safe lid) inside the oven. Preheat the oven to 450°F (230°C) with the pot inside for 45 minutes-1 hour.

tasks.title: Step 13
tasks.instruction: Carefully remove the pot from the oven and place it on a trivet or heat-safe surface. (Be careful! It’ll be VERY HOT.)

tasks.title: Step 14
tasks.instruction: Turn the proofed dough over onto a lightly floured surface and carefully place it inside the pot.

tasks.title: Step 15
tasks.instruction: Cover with the lid and return the pot to the oven.

tasks.title: Step 16
tasks.instruction: Bake for 45 minutes, removing the lid for the last 15 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 17
tasks.instruction: Remove bread from pot, cover, and let cool for 10 minutes before slicing.

tasks.title: Step 18
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

tasks.title: Step 2

tasks.title: Step 3

tasks.title: Step 4

tasks.title: Step 5

Great Value Heavy Whipping Cream, 16 Oz
ingredients.description: 1/2 cup heavy cream,1 1/3 cups heavy cream

ingredients.name: Great Value Ground Thyme, 1.4 oz
Sprout House Fresh Cut Bay Leaves - .25oz
Great Value Frozen Sweet Peas, 12 oz Steamable Bag
Fresh Curly Parsley Bunch, Each
Great Value Double Acting Baking Powder, 8.1 oz
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: In a 6-quart Dutch oven, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned on both sides. Remove from the pot and set aside.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Add carrot and onion and cook until just tender, about 3 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Add the garlic and stir for another minute, until fragrant.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Reduce the heat to medium-low and add the butter and flour, stirring constantly for 3 minutes to prevent lumps from forming.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Add the chicken and any accumulated juices back to the pot and stir to coat in the roux.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Add the chicken broth, cream, thyme, and bay leaves and bring to a simmer. Once soup is at a simmer, add the frozen peas, cover, and cook for 15 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Make the dumplings: In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, salt, pepper, and cream. Stir until mixture comes together into single mass of dough.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Using a large spoon or ice cream scoop, form the dough into small round balls about 1 inch (2 1/2 cm) in diameter (the dough should yield 14-16 dumplings).

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Place the dough balls in the simmering soup (making sure they don’t touch), add the parsley, and cover. Let the soup simmer for 15 minutes, or until the dumplings are cooked through.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Ladle into bowls, giving 1-2 dumplings per serving.

tasks.title: Step 11
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

Great Value Grated Parmesan Cheese, 8 oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: “Bloom” the yeast by sprinkling the sugar and yeast in the warm water. Let sit for 10 minutes, until bubbles form on the surface.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In a large bowl, combine the flour and salt. Make a well in the middle and add the olive oil and bloomed yeast mixture. Using a spoon, mix until a shaggy dough begins to form.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Once the flour is mostly hydrated, turn the dough out onto a clean work surface and knead for 10-15 minutes. The dough should be soft, smooth, and bouncy. Form the dough into a taut round.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Grease a clean, large bowl with olive oil and place the dough inside, turning to coat with the oil. Cover with plastic wrap. Let rise for at least an hour, or up to 24 hours.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Punch down the dough and turn it out onto a lightly floured work surface. Knead for another minute or so, then cut into 4 equal portions and shape into rounds.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Lightly flour the dough, then cover with a kitchen towel and let rest for another 30 minutes to an hour while you prepare the sauce and any other ingredients.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Preheat the oven as high as your oven will allow, between 450-500°F (230-260°C). Place a pizza stone, heavy baking sheet (turn upside down so the surface is flat), or cast iron skillet in the oven.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Meanwhile, make the tomato sauce: Add the salt to the can of tomatoes and puree with an immersion blender, or transfer to a blender or food processor, and puree until smooth.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Once the dough has rested, take a portion and start by poking the surface with your fingertips, until bubbles form and do not deflate.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Then, stretch and press the dough into a thin round. Make it thinner than you think it should be, as it will slightly shrink and puff up during baking.

tasks.title: Step 11
tasks.instruction: Sprinkle semolina onto an upside down baking sheet and place the stretched crust onto it. Add the sauce and ingredients of your choice.

tasks.title: Step 12
tasks.instruction: Slide the pizza onto the preheated pizza stone or pan. Bake for 15 minutes, or until the crust and cheese are golden brown.

tasks.title: Step 13
tasks.instruction: Add any garnish of your preference.

tasks.title: Step 14
tasks.instruction: Nutrition Calories: 1691 Fat: 65 grams Carbs: 211 grams Fiber: 12 grams Sugars: 60 grams Protein: 65 grams

tasks.title: Step 15
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: King Arthur Flour Unbleached All-Purpose Flour 5 lb. Bag

ingredients.description: 2 tablespoons sesame oil,1 teaspoon sesame oil for dipping sauce

ingredients.name: Pork Country Style Ribs Boneless, 1.1 - 2.5 lb, Tray

ingredients.description: 1/4 cup rice wine vinegar for dipping sauce

ingredients.name: Great Value Organic Red Pepper Flakes, 1.2 oz
ingredients.description: 1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flake for dipping sauce

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: In a large bowl, combine the flour, 1 teaspoon of salt, and the warm water and mix until well-combined.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Roll out dough on a floured surface and knead until smooth.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Divide the dough into 4 equal parts.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Roll out 1 piece of dough into a thin log and divide into 6 or 8 pieces, depending on the size of dumplings you want. Repeat with the remaining dough portions.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Lightly flour the dough pieces and roll out 1 piece into a thin circle roughly 4-inches (10 cm) in diameter.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Keep the dumpling wrappers separated with a small piece of parchment paper and repeat with the remaining dough.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Combine the cabbage, green onions, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, and sesame oil in a medium bowl and mix until well-incorporated.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: For the pork filling, combine the ground pork with the remaining teaspoon of salt, the pepper and 1 cup (125g) of the cabbage mixture and stir until well-incorporated.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: For the veggie filling, combine the mushrooms and carrot and microwave for 3 minutes, until soft. Add 1 cup (125g) of the cabbage mixture and stir until well-incorporated.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: For the shrimp filling, combine the shrimp with 1 cup (125g) of the cabbage mixture and stir until well-incorporated.

tasks.title: Step 11
tasks.instruction: To assemble the dumplings, add roughly 1 heaping tablespoon of filling to the center of a dumpling wrapper. With your finger, lightly coat half of the outside of the wrapper with water. Fold the moistened half of the wrapper over the filling and, using your fingers, pleat the edges to seal. Repeat with the remaining fillings and wrappers.

tasks.title: Step 12
tasks.instruction: Heat the oil over medium high in a large skillet and add a few dumplings, cooking them in batches. Once the bottoms of the dumplings start to brown, add a splash of water and cover with a lid. Steam for about 5 minutes, or until the dumplings are cooked and the water has evaporated. Transfer the cooked dumplings to a paper towel-lined plate to remove any excess moisture or grease.

tasks.title: Step 13
tasks.instruction: In a small bowl, combine the soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, and pepper flakes and stir to combine. Serve the dumplings immediately with the dipping sauce.

tasks.title: Step 14
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Great Value Distilled Water, 1 Gallon

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: In a bowl, mix water, salt, and sugar until combined. Add yeast, and let rest 5 minutes until yeast starts to foam.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Add flour and 2 tablespoons of oil, and mix thoroughly until a dough forms.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Remove the dough and use the remaining oil to cover the bowl.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Cover bowl with plastic wrap, and leave in a warm place for 1 hour.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C).

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Cut dough into 8 pieces and roll them out into thin ropes, twisting the two ends to form a pretzel shape.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Add baking soda to a large pot of water, and bring to a rolling boil. Boil each pretzel for 30 seconds per side.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Transfer pretzels to a baking sheet, brush with egg wash, and sprinkle with salt. Bake for 10-15 minutes, until golden brown.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

tasks.instruction: Break the head of cauliflower into florets, about 1 1/2-inches wide. Add the cauliflower florets to the batter, making sure each piece is evenly coated. Arrange the coated cauliflower on the baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes, flipping halfway.
