Rocket Farms Fresh Cut Rosemary, .75 oz
Great Value Ground Thyme, 1.4 oz
Sage Fresh Cut .75oz
White Onions, Each
Garlic Bulb, Each

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: 1.Season pork chops with salt, pepper and paprika on both sides. Let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: 2.Heat oil in a 12-inch cast-iron skillet over medium-high. Add pork chops and cook, flipping occasionally, until well browned and a thermometer inserted into thickest portion of meat near (but not touching) the bone registers 120 F, 10 to 14 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: 3.Reduce heat to medium and move pork chops to one side of the skillet. Add butter, rosemary, thyme, sage, onions, and garlic to other side of skillet; cook, basting pork with butter and drippings, until a thermometer inserted in the thickest portion of meat registers 140 F, 2 to 4 minutes. Remove from heat and let the pork rest until it reaches 145 F, about 5 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: 4.When ready to serve, serve whole or slice against the grain. Spoon butter-herb mixture over top.

a88223d104c20b454ca996edd85b8827.title: One-pan spicy chicken thighs with orzo
a88223d104c20b454ca996edd85b8827.description: Bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs are the MVP in this dish because they’re almost impossible to overcook and you get so much flavor from them. As the chicken thighs cook, the fat renders, resulting in a gorgeous schmaltzy orzo that will steal your heart. In addition to all of that rich chicken fat, this dish has Calabrian chilis and a lot of garlic, bringing complexity to the dish in low-effort ways. All of this deliciousness is mixed in with chicken stock and green beans to round out the meal. The green beans sit directly under the chicken thighs, cooking until they’re done but still crunchy, and the orzo is toasted so that it develops even more flavor.

ingredients.name: Foster Farms Fresh & Natural Cage Free Family Pack Chicken Thighs 64 -88 oz (4-5.5 lb) Tray
ingredients.description: 2 pounds bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs (about 6 thighs)

ingredients.name: Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce
Heinz Chili Sauce, 12 oz Bottle
Great Value Extra Virgin Olive Oil, 17 fl oz
Great Value Sweet Cream Unsalted Butter, 16 oz
Yellow Onions, Each
Garlic Bulb, Each
ingredients.description: 4 cloves garlic, peeled and thinly sliced

ingredients.name: Great Value Cut Green Beans, Canned Green Beans, 14.5 oz Can
Dal Raccolto Orzo Pasta, 16 Ounce
Great Value Grated Parmesan Cheese, 8 oz
Great Value Chicken Broth, 14.5 oz Can
Concord Foods Lemon Juice, 4.5 oz
Fresh Curly Parsley Bunch, Each
ingredients.description: 1/2 cup fresh parsley leaves, for garnish

ingredients.name: Calabrian Chili Hot Sauce "Hot & Tangy" by Tutto Calabria 8.8oz.
McCormick Gourmet California Lemon Peel, 1.5 oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: 1.Preheat the oven to 375 F.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: 2.In a large mixing bowl, combine the chicken thighs, kosher salt, Calabrian chilis and extra-virgin olive oil. Toss to combine, thoroughly coating the chicken thighs.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: 3.Melt the butter in a large 12-inch skillet or Dutch oven on the stove over medium-high heat. Place half of the chicken thighs skin-side down in the hot pan and sear for about 5 minutes, until the skin is golden. Flip to cook the other side, about 3 minutes. Transfer the seared chicken thighs to a plate, set aside and repeat with the remaining chicken thighs. Scrape any excess marinade from the chicken into the skillet.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: 4.Turn the stove down to medium-low heat and add the onions to the skillet, cooking for about 5 minutes until translucent. Add the garlic and cook, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the green beans and cook for 2 minutes more. Add the orzo to the skillet and mix to thoroughly combine, toasting for about 3 minutes. Turn off the heat and stir in the Parmesan.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: 5.Pour the chicken broth and lemon juice into the skillet and stir to combine. Nestle the chicken thighs back into the orzo mixture.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: 6.Carefully transfer the skillet to the oven. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes until the chicken is cooked through and all the liquid has been absorbed.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: 7.To serve, garnish with parsley, chilis, lemon zest and flaky salt.

ca6989ed22e86cbfc1245e5d5e7ef0e8.title: Green goddess pasta salad
ca6989ed22e86cbfc1245e5d5e7ef0e8.description: Green goddess dressing use the fresh flavor of summer — basil! Whole-milk Greek yogurt starts the dressing off on a tangy note, which is tempered by the creaminess of mayonnaise. Anchovies adds  a delicious dose of salinity and a whole lot of basil gives the dressing its signature color. The herby dressing gets tossed with orecchiette. The little wells and ridges of the orecchiette trap the dressing inside and leave just enough room for the vegetables in this salad. Bright green, saucy noodles are accented by crisp sweet corn, sliced snap peas and chopped arugula.

ingredients.name: DeLallo Orecchiette Pasta, 16 oz
Great Value Whole Milk Plain Greek Yogurt, 32 oz
ingredients.description: 1 3/4 cups whole milk Greek yogurt, for green goddess dressing

ingredients.name: Great Value Mayonnaise, 15 fl oz
ingredients.description: 1/2 cup mayonnaise, for green goddess dressing

ingredients.name: Great Value Extra Virgin Olive Oil, 17 fl oz
ingredients.description: 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, for green goddess dressing

ingredients.name: Basil Fresh Cut 0.75 oz
ingredients.description: 2 cups fresh torn basil leaves, for green goddess dressing

ingredients.name: Season Brand Flat Fillet Anchovies in 100% Olive Oil, Glass Jar, 4.2 ounces
ingredients.description: 4 anchovy filets in oil, for green goddess dressing

ingredients.name: Garlic Bulb, Each
ingredients.description: 2 garlic cloves, peeled, for green goddess dressing

ingredients.name: Concord Foods Lemon Juice, 4.5 oz
ingredients.description: 2 tablespoons lemon juice, for green goddess dressing

ingredients.name: Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce
ingredients.description: 2 teaspoons kosher salt, for green goddess dressing

ingredients.name: Marketside Fresh Sugar Snap Peas, 8 oz
ingredients.description: 2 cups snap peas, thinly sliced, for salad

ingredients.name: Jolly Time White Popcorn Kernels Bag, 32 oz Gluten-Free, Non-GMO.
Marketside Organic Baby Arugula Salad, 5 oz Clam Shell, Fresh

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: 1.Bring a large pot of heavily salted water to a boil. Add in the pasta and cook according to package directions for al dente, about 9 minutes. Drain the pasta and rinse with cold water to prevent the pasta from sticking together.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: 2.While the water is coming to a boil, or the pasta is cooking, make the green goddess dressing. In the base of a food processor, add all OF the dressing ingredients and blend until the mixture is smooth and bright green. This should take 3 to 5 minutes and may require you to periodically scrape down the sides of your food processor to ensure all the ingredients are blended.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: 3.Add the cooked pasta to a large mixing bowl and toss with the dressing. Fold in the snap peas, corn and arugula.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: 4.Season with additional salt and pepper to taste and serve right away, or refrigerate and serve within 2 to 3 days.

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweet Cream Salted Butter, 16 oz
Garlic Bulb, Each
Great Value Finely Shredded Parmesan Cheese, 6 oz
Great Value Finely Shredded Colby Jack Cheese, 8 oz
Great Value Finely Shredded Mild Cheddar Cheese, 8 oz
Fresh Green Onions Bunch, Each
Marketside French Baguette Bread, Bake at Home, 10 oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Pour in the beef broth and one cup of water and bring to a simmer.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: In a bowl, combine all of the ingredients except the baguette, and mix until smooth.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Slice the baguette in half lengthwise, then spread the butter mixture evenly on both sides of the baguette.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Place on a tray lined with parchment paper and bake for about 15 minutes, until cheese is bubbly and starting to brown on the edges.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Slice, cool, then serve.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Fresh Atlantic Salmon Portions, 0.70 - 1.1 lbs
Great Value Classic Olive Oil, 17 fl oz
ingredients.description: 1 tablespoon olive oil,1 tablespoon olive oil

ingredients.name: Garlic Bulb, Each
Fresh Ginger Root, Each
Great Value Crushed Red Pepper, 1.75 oz
Great Value Less Sodium Soy Sauce, 15 fl oz
Great Value Organic Strained Raw Honey, 12 oz Inverted Plastic Bottle

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Place salmon in a sealable bag or medium bowl.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In a small bowl or measuring cup, mix marinade ingredients.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Pour half of the marinade on the salmon. Save the other half for later.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Let the salmon marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: In a medium pan, heat oil. Add salmon to the pan, but discard the used marinade. Cook salmon on one side for about 2-3 minutes, then flip over and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Remove salmon from pan. Pour in remaining marinade and reduce.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Serve the salmon with sauce and a side of veggies. We used broccoli.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Russet Potatoes, 5 lb Bag
Great Value Sweet Cream Salted Butter, 16 oz
Great Value Heavy Whipping Cream, 16 Oz
Great Value Finely Shredded Parmesan Cheese, 6 oz
Great Value Garlic Powder, 3.4 oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Great Value Canola Oil Non-Stick Cooking Spray, 8 oz
Great Value All Natural Sour Cream, 8 oz Tub

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Trim the ends of the potatoes, then slice into ¼-inch thick rounds.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Add the potato rounds to a large bowl with the melted butter, heavy cream, Parmesan cheese, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Grease a muffin tin with nonstick spray, then stack about 10-12 potato rounds in each muffin cup.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Bake for about 1 hour, or until the potato stacks are well browned.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Let cool slightly, then serve with sour cream.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Sam's Choice Frozen Wild Caught Cold Water Lobster Tails with Butter, 9 oz
Great Value Sweet Cream Salted Butter, 16 oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Great Value Garlic Powder, 3.4 oz
Great Value Paprika, 2.5 oz
Fresh Curly Parsley Bunch, Each
Concord Foods Lemon Juice, 4.5 oz
Lemons, Each
Fresh Broccoli Crowns, Each

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Using a clean pair of scissors or kitchen shears, cut along the middle of the top of the shell towards the fins of the tail, making sure to cut in a straight line. Do not cut through the end of the tail.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Using a spoon, separate the meat from the two sides of the shell, then lift the meat up and out from inside the shell.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Press the two sides of the shell together, then lay the meat over the seam where the two shells meet.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: If you are having difficulty opening the shell up to lift out the meat, flip the tail over and make cuts along the carapace where the legs meet the bottom part tail. This will help break the rigid structure of the shell and allow it to be more flexible.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: While cutting through the shell, you may have also cut into the meat, which is perfectly okay. Make a shallow cut through the middle of the lobster meat so that you can peel down the thin layer of meat over the sides. This gives the lobster tail its signature look.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C).

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: In a small bowl, combine the butter, salt, pepper, garlic powder, paprika, lemon juice, and parsley, then brush the mixture evenly over the lobster meat.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Place the tails onto a baking sheet, then bake for approximately 12-15 minutes, until the lobster is fully cooked but not rubbery.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Serve with a side of broccoli and a lemon wedge.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

4d308cddeb72f1f1a47ae2232cfacbf6.title: Prime rib with garlic herb butter
4d308cddeb72f1f1a47ae2232cfacbf6.description: Prime Rib With Garlic Herb Butter

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweet Cream Salted Butter, 16 oz
Garlic Bulb, Each
Rocket Farms Fresh Cut Rosemary, .75 oz
Mariposa Farms Fresh Cut Thyme, .75 oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Beef Choice Angus Ribeye Steak, 1.5 - 2.6 lb, Tray
King Arthur Flour Unbleached All-Purpose Flour 5 lb. Bag
Idahoan Roasted Garlic Mashed Potatoes, 4 oz Pouch
Great Value Cut Green Beans, Canned Green Beans, 14.5 oz Can

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Preheat oven to 500°F (260°C).

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Mix together the butter, garlic, herbs, salt, and pepper in a bowl until evenly combined.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Rub the herb butter all over the rib roast, then place on a roasting tray with a rack.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Bake for 5 minutes per pound (10 minutes per kilo) of meat, so a 5-pound (2.2 kg) roast would bake for 25 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Turn off the heat and let the rib roast sit in the oven for 2 hours, making sure you do not open the oven door or else the residual heat will escape.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Once the 2 hours are up, remove the roast from the pan and pour the pan drippings into a saucepan over medium heat.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Add the flour, whisking until there are no lumps, then add the beef stock, stirring and bringing the sauce to a boil.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Remove from heat and strain the sauce into a gravy dish.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Carve the prime rib into 3/4-inch (20 mm) slices.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Serve with the mashed potatoes, green beans, and sauce!

tasks.title: Step 11
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Beef Choice Angus Filet Mignon, 0.45 - 0.9 lb, Tray
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
ingredients.description: freshly ground black pepper, to taste

ingredients.name: Pompeian Grapeseed Oil - 24 fl oz
ingredients.description: 1 tablespoon grapeseed oil, or other high-heat, neutral oil of choice

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweet Cream Unsalted Butter, 16 oz
Rocket Farms Fresh Cut Rosemary, .75 oz
Garlic Bulb, Each

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: On a cutting board, pat the filet mignon dry with paper towels and let sit at room temperature for 20-30 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Preheat the oven to 450°F (230°C).

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Generously season all sides of the filet mignon with salt and pepper.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Heat a medium, oven-safe stainless steel or cast iron skillet over high heat for 5 minutes. Add the grapeseed oil.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Once the oil beings to smoke, add the filet mignon to the pan. Cook without moving for 2-3 minutes, until a crust has formed.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Use tongs to flip the steak over, then add the butter, rosemary, and garlic to the pan.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Tilt the pan and spoon the butter continuously over the steak for 2-3 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Transfer the pan to the oven for 7 minutes for a medium rare steak

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Transfer the steak to a cutting board and let rest for at least 10 minutes before slicing.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweet Cream Salted Butter, 16 oz
Garlic Bulb, Each
Yellow Onions, Each
Great Value Chopped Spinach, 12 oz (Frozen)
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
ingredients.description: 1 teaspoon salt, for spinach,1 teaspoon salt, for salmon

ingredients.name: McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
ingredients.description: 1 teaspoon pepper, for spinach,1 teaspoon pepper, for salmon

ingredients.name: Great Value Italian Style Bread Crumbs, 15 oz
Great Value Cream Cheese, 8 oz
Great Value Finely Shredded Parmesan Cheese, 6 oz
Sprout House Fresh Cut Dill - 0.75oz
Pepperidge Farm Puff Pastry Frozen Pastry Dough Sheets, 2-Count, 17.3 oz. Box
ingredients.description: 1 sheet puff pastry, softened to room temperature

ingredients.name: Great Value Frozen Wild Caught Pink Salmon Skin-on Fillets, 2 lb
Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In a pan over medium heat, melt butter. Add the garlic and onions, cooking until translucent.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Add the spinach, salt, and pepper, cooking until spinach is wilted.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Add the breadcrumbs, cream cheese, parmesan, and dill, stirring until mixture is evenly combined. Remove from heat and set aside.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: On a cutting board, smooth out the sheet of puff pastry. Place the salmon in the middle of the pastry and season both sides with salt and pepper.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Place several spoonfuls of the spinach mixture on top of the salmon, smoothing it out so that it does not spill over the sides.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Fold the edges of the puff pastry over the salmon and spinach, starting with the longer sides and then the shorter ends. Trim any excess pastry from the ends, then fold the ends on top. Flip the puff pastry-wrapped salmon over and transfer for a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Brush the beaten egg on the top and sides of the pastry. Score the top of the pastry with a knife, cutting shallow diagonal lines to create a crosshatch pattern.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Brush the top again with the egg wash.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Bake for 20-25 minutes, until pastry is golden brown.

tasks.title: Step 11
tasks.instruction: Slice, then serve!

tasks.title: Step 12
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Great Value Classic Olive Oil, 17 fl oz
Yellow Onions, Each
Fresh Whole Carrots, 1 lb Bag
Fresh Celery Sticks, 20 oz Bag
Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Garlic Bulb, Each
Great Value Reduced Sodium Chicken Broth, 32oz Carton
Great Value Wide Egg Noodles Enriched Product, 16 oz
Foster Farms Fresh & Natural Boneless & Skinless Chicken Breast Fillets, 1.6 - 2.39 lb
Fresh Italian Parsley Bunch, Each
Great Value Finely Shredded Parmesan Cheese, 6 oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Heat the olive oil until shimmering over medium heat in a large soup pot. Add the onion, carrots, celery, and 1 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Cooking, stirring frequently, until the vegetables are very soft, about 15 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the stock and bring to a boil.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: MAKE AHEAD: Do not add the noodles or parsley. Cool and refrigerate the soup in an airtight container for four days, or in the freezer for up to two months. Reheat on the stove and add the noodles and parsley just before serving.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Add the noodles and cook 6 minutes, then add the chicken and cook about 2 minutes more, until the noodles are cooked through and the chicken is warmed through.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Season to taste with salt and pepper, then stir in the parsley.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Serve topped with Parmesan.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Marketside Butcher Grass-Fed Beef Ribeye Steak, 0.625-1.5 lb (Fresh)
ingredients.description: 1 thick rib eye steak, 2 in (5 cm) preferably USDA prime

ingredients.name: Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Great Value Canola Oil, 48 fl oz
Great Value Sweet Cream Salted Butter, 16 oz
Garlic Bulb, Each
Rocket Farms Fresh Cut Rosemary, .75 oz
Mariposa Farms Fresh Cut Thyme, .75 oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Preheat oven to 200°F/95°C

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Pat the steak dry with a paper towel, and generously season all sides of the steak with salt and pepper.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Transfer to a wire rack on top of a baking sheet, and bake for about 45 minutes to an hour, until the internal temperature reads about 125°F/50°C for medium-rare. Adjust the bake time if you like your steak more rare or well-done.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Heat the canola oil in a pan over high heat until smoking. Do not use olive oil, as its smoke point is significantly lower than that of canola oil and will smoke before reaching the desired cooking temperature.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Sear the steak for 1 minute on one side, then flip.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Add the butter, garlic, rosemary, and thyme, and swirl around the pan. Transfer the garlic and herbs on top of the steak and baste the steak with the butter using a large spoon.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Baste for about 1 minute, then flip the steak with tongs and baste the other side for about 15 seconds.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Turn the steak on its side and cook to render off any excess fat.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

af838805a5c312d153533b9dd75a5291.title: Enchilada stuffed peppers
af838805a5c312d153533b9dd75a5291.description: These cheesy stuffed peppers pack in all the flavors of your favorite enchiladas. They’re perfect for Sunday dinner, or make them ahead and reheat them for a quick weeknight meal.

ingredients.name: Great Value Spring Water, 1 Gallon
Crisco Pure Vegetable Oil, 16 fl oz
Yellow Onions, Each
Garlic Bulb, Each
Prima Della Cajun Turkey Breast, Deli Sliced
ingredients.description: 1 pound ground chicken or ground turkey breast

ingredients.name: Great Value Chili Powder, 3 oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
Great Value Black Beans, 15 oz Can
ingredients.description: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed

ingredients.name: Great Value Red Enchilada Sauce, 10 oz
Great Value Finely Shredded Fiesta Blend Cheese, 8 oz
ingredients.description: 1 package (8 ounces) fiesta blend cheese, divided

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Cut the tops off the peppers and remove the seeds. Place the peppers cut side up in a baking pan filled with ½ cup water. Bake at 350ºF for 10 minutes to soften.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Meanwhile, heat the oil in a skillet. When the oil is shimmering, add the onion and garlic; cook 2-3 minutes, until translucent.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Add the ground chicken or turkey to the pan and cook, stirring occasionally, for 8-9 minutes or until no longer pink.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Stir in the chili powder, salt, beans, enchilada sauce, and half of the cheese.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Spoon the meat mixture into the peppers. Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 30 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Uncover the peppers and sprinkle the remaining cheese on top. Return to the oven and bake for 5 minutes, until the cheese is melted.

3306f6aa6919aea7e9f330c47ad928fb.title: Creamy steak pasta with button mushroom
3306f6aa6919aea7e9f330c47ad928fb.description: This steak pasta is packed with flavor and easy to make even on a busy weeknight. A creamy and delicious pasta dish that is perfect for a comforting dinner you will make over and over again.

ingredients.name: Barilla Classic Rigatoni Pasta, 16 oz Box
ingredients.description: 16 oz Rigatoni Pasta, or any short-cut pasta of your choice

ingredients.name: Great Value Spring Water, 1 Gallon
Beef Cubed Steak, 0.73 - 2.05 lb, Tray
ingredients.description: 1 1/2 lb. Flat Iron Steak, sliced thinly

ingredients.name: Freshness Guaranteed Sliced White Mushrooms, 8 oz
Yellow Onions, Each
Great Value Sweet Cream Unsalted Butter, 16 oz
Great Value Beef Broth, 14.5 oz
Great Value Heavy Whipping Cream, 16 Oz
Great Value Finely Shredded Parmesan Cheese, 6 oz
ingredients.description: 1 1/2 cups Shredded Parmesan Cheese, plus a handful for topping

ingredients.name: Great Value Garlic Powder, 3.4 oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Fresh Italian Parsley Bunch, Each

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: In a large stock pot over medium-low heat, fill half the stock pot with water, bring to boil. Once the water is boiling, add pasta, season with 1 1/2 teaspoon salt and cook according to the package direction. Reserve 3/4 cup of the pasta water. Remove from heat and drain the pasta. Set aside.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In a skillet over medium-high heat, melt the butter. Cook onion until softened and stir occasionally.  Add in the sliced beef, sear and brown for about 3 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Season the beef with garlic powder, salt and pepper. Add in sliced mushrooms, stir for another minute then reduce heat to medium.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: In the same skillet, over medium heat add stock and bring to boil and pour heavy cream and pasta water, stir until liquid is reduced and thickened (about 3-5 minutes).

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Add Parmesan and cooked pasta, stir until well combined. Add pepper to taste. Remove from heat.

1e914aadd428906d87d7a128d9446ee2.title: Cajun dirty rice
1e914aadd428906d87d7a128d9446ee2.description: Dirty rice is a classic Cajun dish that is deliciously zesty, comforting, and great to serve as a main or side dish! This quick and easy homemade Cajun Dirty is made entirely in one pot and can be ready in under an hour! This New Orleans style rice is bursting with robust flavors – it’s overflowing with browned meats with the Trinity (onions, green peppers, and celery) and deeply flavorful Creole spices. This dish is a hearty and satisfying tast of the french quarter.

ingredients.name: Foster Farms Always Natural Chicken Gizzards & Hearts 14.4 - 32 oz (.9 - 2 lb) Tray
Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce
Great Value Spring Water, 1 Gallon
Great Value Canola Oil, 48 fl oz
Beef Chuck Roast, 2.0 - 2.65 lb, Tray
Yellow Onions, Each
Fresh Green Bell Pepper, Each
Fresh Celery Stalk, Each
Garlic Bulb, Each
Sprout House Fresh Cut Bay Leaves - .25oz
Great Value Worcestershire Sauce, 10 fl Ounce
Great Value Oregano Leaves, 0.87 oz
Tony Chachere’s, Seasoning, Cajun, More Spice, 7 oz
Lawry's Casero Cayenne Pepper, 1.62 oz
Mahatma Enriched Extra Long Grain White Rice 2 lb Bag
Fresh Green Onions Bunch, Each

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: To a large, heavy bottom pot or Dutch oven over high heat add gizzards, salt, and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer and cover for 30 minutes. Skim foam off the water as gizzards cook. Use a slotted spoon to remove gizzards and reserve 3 cups of stock in a separate container.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Cut the gizzards from the tough sinew, then chop the gizzards until they resemble ground meat. You can also chop them in a food processor. Set aside.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Cut the gizzards from the tough sinew, then chop the gizzards until they resemble ground meat. You can also chop them in a food processor. Set aside.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Stir in the rice and bay leaves. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to a simmer and cover for 12-15 minutes or until rice is cooked.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Remove bay leaves, discard and let rice rest for 10 minutes. Fluff rice, garnish with green onions, and serve.

5562f26312f4b613c50d67d51f4e167c.title: Sweet & spicy bacon wrapped little smokies
5562f26312f4b613c50d67d51f4e167c.description: These deliciously sweet and spicy Little Smokies are wrapped in bacon and then coated in a tangy brown sugar cayenne mixture. The cayenne pepper provides just the right amount of heat to balance out the sweetness of the brown sugar. This bite-sized appetizer is perfect for game day or any other party or gathering. Your guests will love them!

ingredients.name: Hillshire Farm Smoked Sausage, 14 oz
Great Value Real Bacon Pieces, 2.5 oz
ingredients.description: 1 pack (12 oz) Center Cut Bacon, halved

ingredients.name: Great Value Light Brown Sugar, 32 oz
Lawry's Casero Cayenne Pepper, 1.62 oz
Great Value Tomato Ketchup, 24 oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Line a baking sheet with foil or parchment paper. Set aside.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: In a shallow dish, combine together brown sugar and cayenne. Set aside.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Wrap a bacon slice around an entire sausage. Repeat this process with the rest of the bacon and sausages.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Roll wrapped sausages on the brown sugar mixture and secure with a toothpick on each of them. Place on the prepared sheet pan.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Bake for 15-20 minutes until the bacon is browned and the sugar is caramelized.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Remove from the oven and transfer to a serving dish. Serve with ketchup on the side.

deae8c91190dd33bb5229361f4d40fdf.title: Southwestern stuffed sweet potatoes
deae8c91190dd33bb5229361f4d40fdf.description: Imagine a burrito stuffed into a sweet potato! This recipe makes good use of your jarred spices and herbs and makes enough filling for leftovers, which you can use for burritos or nachos, or freeze up to 3 months!

ingredients.name: Fresh Sweet Potatoes, 3 lb Bag
Mahatma Enriched Extra Long Grain White Rice 2 lb Bag
Great Value Classic Olive Oil, 17 fl oz
Yellow Onions, Each
Garlic Bulb, Each
Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Great Value Chili Powder, 3 oz
Great Value Ground Cumin, 2.5 oz
McCormick Gourmet Organic Ground Coriander, 1.25 oz
Litehouse Freeze Dried Oregano, 0.28 Oz
Lawry's Casero Cayenne Pepper, 1.62 oz
ingredients.description: 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper, optional, or more to taste

ingredients.name: Great Value Black Beans, 15 oz Can
ingredients.description: 1 (15-ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed

ingredients.name: Kraft Mexican Style Four Cheese Blend Shredded Cheese, 8 oz Bag
Great Value Mild Thick & Chunky Salsa, 24 oz
Avocados, Each
Great Value All Natural Sour Cream, 8 oz Tub
ingredients.description: 1/2 cup sour cream or plain Greek yogurt, for assembly

ingredients.name: Fresh Cilantro, Bunch
ingredients.description: 1/3 cup fresh cilantro, chopped, for assembly
1 cup bell pepper any color, diced

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Bake the sweet potatoes right on the oven rack for 45 to 50 minutes or until the middle pierces easily with a fork. While they’re baking, cook the rice according to package directions and set aside.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In deep 12-inch skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat and cook the diced onion and bell pepper until they begin to soften, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic, and reduce heat to medium. Add the salt, pepper, chili powder, cumin, coriander, dried oregano and cayenne (if using), stirring to coat. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes until garlic becomes aromatic.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Add the drained and rinsed can of black beans and heat through over medium heat for about 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in a cup of cooked rice (or more, if you like).

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Remove the potatoes from the oven and place them on a rimmed baking sheet. Turn the oven up to 450 degrees F.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Cut the potatoes open a few inches, just enough to add the filling. Heap on the black bean and rice mixture and sprinkle a few tablespoons of cheese over each potato. Return to the preheated oven for 3 to 5 minutes, or until the cheese melts. Remove from the oven and serve immediately with the toppings.

ingredients.name: Freshness Guaranteed Fuji Apples, 3 lb Bag
ingredients.description: 2 lb apple, (Golden / Ginger gold / Canada / Boskoop / Fuji)

ingredients.name: Great Value Spring Water, 1 Gallon
Concord Foods Lemon Juice, 4.5 oz
Fresh Ginger Root, Each
Great Value Kosher Ground Cinnamon, 2.5 Oz
McCormick Black Pepper Grinder, 1 oz Pepper & Peppercorns
Great Value Organic Strained Raw Honey, 12 oz Inverted Plastic Bottle

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Peel the apples, remove the core, and cut the apples into small equal pieces. Put the apple pieces in a pot and add water.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Add all the other ingredients: Lemon juice, cinnamon, pepper, and ginger. Simmer for 2 minutes at high flame while gently mixing all the ingredients with a wooden spoon.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Cover it and reduce the flame to medium for 5 minutes to bring to a boil.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Uncover it, add honey, then gently mix again with the wooden spoon, cover it and simmer on low flame for 20 minutes. Cook until you get a soft texture. Add 5 minutes if necessary.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Serve warm and/or store.

ingredients.name: Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
ingredients.description: 2 large eggs, beaten for Dip, 1 large egg, lightly beaten for pie crust cookies

ingredients.name: C&H Premium Pure Cane Granulated Sugar, 1 lb Box
ingredients.description: 1/4 cup granulated sugar for pie crust cookies

ingredients.name: Great Value Light Corn Syrup, 16 fl oz
ingredients.description: 3/4 cup light corn syrup for Dip

ingredients.name: Great Value Pure Vanilla Extract, 1 fl oz
Great Value Light Brown Sugar, 32 oz
ingredients.description: 1/3 cup light brown sugar for Dip

ingredients.name: Great Value Kosher Ground Cinnamon, 2.5 Oz
ingredients.description: 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon for pie crust cookies

ingredients.name: Great Value Graham 9" Pie Crust, 6 oz
ingredients.description: 2 pre-made pie doughs, 8-inch rounds for pie crust cookies

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweetened Dried Cranberries, 6 OZ
ingredients.description: 1/2 cup dried cranberries, plus more for Dip garnish

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweet Cream Salted Butter, 16 oz
ingredients.description: 3 tablespoons butter, cubed and chilled for Dip

ingredients.name: Great Value Semi-Sweet Chocolate Baking Chips, 12 oz
ingredients.description: 1/2 cup semisweet chocolate chips for Dip

ingredients.name: Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce
Maple Grove Farms Organic Pure Maple Syrup, 8.5 fl oz
Great Value Pecan Halves, 8 oz
ingredients.description: 1 cup toasted pecan pieces, plus more for Dip garnish

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Make the pie crust cookies: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In a small bowl, stir together the sugar and cinnamon.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Unroll each pie dough round and brush with the beaten egg. Sprinkle the cinnamon sugar evenly over the dough to cover completely.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Using a 2-inch square cookie cutter, cut out as many pieces as you can from the dough and place on the prepared baking sheets, spacing evenly.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Bake the cookies until golden brown, about 10 minutes. Let the cookies cool slightly, about 5 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: While the cookies bake, make the dip: In a large, high-walled skillet, whisk together the corn syrup, brown sugar, maple syrup, and eggs. Turn the heat to medium-low and continue whisking until the mixture is homogeneous and begins to turn frothy and light brown, about 10 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Remove the pan from the heat and whisk in the butter, vanilla, and salt until the butter is completely melted.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Add the pecans, chocolate chips, and dried cranberries and stir until fully incorporated.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Transfer the dip to a serving bowl and garnish with more dried cranberries and toasted pecans. Serve warm with the pie crust cookies for dipping.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Great Value Light Brown Sugar, 32 oz
King Arthur Flour Unbleached All-Purpose Flour 5 lb. Bag
ingredients.description: 2 cups flour for crust, 1/2 cup flour for topping, 1/5 flour for filling

ingredients.name: C & H Pure Granulated White Cane Sugar, 4 lb
Crisco All-Vegetable Shortening, 16 oz
Great Value Finely Shredded Mild Cheddar Cheese, 8 oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
ingredients.description: 1/4 teaspoon salt for crust, 1/4 teaspoon salt for filling

ingredients.name: Great Value Pure Vanilla Extract, 1 fl oz
Gala Apples, Each
Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value All Natural Sour Cream, 8 oz Tub
Great Value Sweet Cream Salted Butter, 16 oz
ingredients.description: 1/4 cup cold butter for crust , 2 tablespoons softened butter for filling, 4 tablespoons softened butter for topping

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Make the crust by mixing flour, salt, and cold butter and shortening cut into bits. Mix in a food processor or with a fork until crumbly and a cornmeal consistency. Add 3 to 4 tablespoons of cold water. Mix and then form into a ball, then roll flat. Put in a 9-inch pie plate and chill for one hour.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Mix softened butter and sugar until well-blended. Add the sour cream, flour, salt, vanilla and eggs and beat until blended. Stir in sliced apples and cheddar cheese and stir gently to coat. Pour into the prepared pie shell.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Bake in a 400°F preheated oven for 30 minutes. (Cover the pie edges with foil or silicone edge covers.)

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Prepare the topping by mixing the softened butter, flour and brown sugar together with a fork. After the pie is baked for 30 minutes, remove the pie and sprinkle on the streusel topping. Put the pie back in the oven and bake for 15 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Remove pie from the oven and cool. Serve.

ea5b43811bbd0c67941de93e482f1941.title: Pineapple upside down cake
ea5b43811bbd0c67941de93e482f1941.description: Frankie cooks his way back in time with his favorite vintage recipes. These oldie-but-goodie dishes are not only nostalgic and comforting, but they’ll also fill you up without costing you a pretty penny.

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweet Cream Unsalted Butter, 16 oz
ingredients.description: 1 stick unsalted butter,2 sticks unsalted butter, melted

ingredients.name: Great Value Light Brown Sugar, 32 oz
ingredients.description: 1 1/8 cup brown sugar,1/2 cup brown sugar

ingredients.name: Great Value Canned Pineapple Slices in 100% Juice, 20 oz
Great Value Maraschino Cherries, 10 Oz
GV All Purpose Flour 2LB Bag
Great Value Double Acting Baking Powder, 8.1 oz
Great Value Baking Soda, 16 oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
C&H Premium Pure Cane Granulated Sugar, 1 lb Box
Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value Greek Plain Nonfat Yogurt, 5.3 oz
Great Value Pure Vanilla Extract, 1 fl oz
Great Value Whole Vitamin D Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Pineapple Topping - Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish and line the bottom with parchment paper.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Pineapple Topping - Heat the butter and brown sugar over low heat in a small saucepan. Stir constantly until the butter melts and brown sugar is fully incorporated. Pour the glaze into the bottom of the baking dish.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Pineapple Topping  - Arrange the pineapple rings and cherries in a single layer on top of the butter and brown sugar glaze.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Vanilla Cake - For the dry ingredients, mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Vanilla Cake - For the wet ingredients, in a separate large bowl, whisk the melted butter, brown sugar and granulated sugar together. Add the eggs, greek yogurt, and vanilla to the wet mixture, and whisk until well incorporated. Stir the dry ingredients into the wet a little at a time, alternating with the milk a little at a time as well. Whisk until batter is just incorporated.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Vanilla Cake - Pour the batter in the pan on top of pineapples. Bake for 40-45 minutes. Allow the cake to cool for 20 minutes before inverting. Top the pan with a cutting board that is slightly larger, and quickly and deliberately flip the pan away from you. Carefully remove parchment paper and cool completely before serving.

ingredients.name: Great Value Creamy Peanut Butter, 18 oz Jar
Great Value Sugar Cannister 20oz
Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Preheat oven to 350ºF (180ºC).

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In a large bowl, mix together the peanut butter, sugar, and egg.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Scoop out a spoonful of dough and roll it into a ball. Place the cookie balls onto a nonstick baking sheet.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: For extra decoration and to make them cook more evenly, flatten the cookie balls by pressing a fork down on top of them, then press it down again at a 90º angle to make a criss-cross pattern.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Bake for 8-10 minutes or until the bottom of the cookies are golden brown.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Remove from baking sheet and cool.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Great Value Semi-Sweet Chocolate Baking Chips, 12 oz
Great Value Sweet Cream Salted Butter, 16 oz
Great Value Sugar Cannister 20oz
Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value Pure Vanilla Extract, 1 fl oz
King Arthur Flour Unbleached All-Purpose Flour 5 lb. Bag
Great Value Baking Unsweetened Cocoa Powder, 8 oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Line an 8-inch (20 cm) square baking dish with parchment paper.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Chop the chocolate into chunks. Melt half of the chocolate in the microwave in 20-second intervals, saving the other half for later.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: In a large bowl, mix the butter and sugar with an electric hand mixer, then beat in the eggs and vanilla for 1-2 minutes, until the mixture becomes fluffy and light in color.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Whisk in the melted chocolate (make sure it's not too hot or else the eggs will cook), then sift in the flour, cocoa powder, and salt. Fold to incorporate the dry ingredients, being careful not to overmix as this will cause the brownies to be more cake-like in texture.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Fold in the chocolate chunks, then transfer the batter to the prepared baking dish.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Bake for 20-25 minutes, depending on how fudgy you like your brownies, then cool completely.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Slice, then serve with a nice cold glass of milk!

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

50148c74dc9b08595fbb3ce43eb63bc3.title: One bowl chocolate chip banana bread
50148c74dc9b08595fbb3ce43eb63bc3.description: One Bowl Chocolate Chip Banana Bread

ingredients.name: Great Value Sliced Bananas, 16 oz (Frozen)
Great Value Sweet Cream Salted Butter, 16 oz
Great Value Sugar Cannister 20oz
Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value Pure Vanilla Extract, 1 fl oz
Great Value Baking Soda, 16 oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
King Arthur Flour Unbleached All-Purpose Flour 5 lb. Bag
Great Value Mini Semi-Sweet Chocolate Baking Chips, 12 oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C).

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In a bowl, add the bananas and mash until smooth. Add in the melted butter and stir until well combined.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Add the sugar, egg, vanilla, baking soda, salt, and flour, and stir until the batter is smooth.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Add in the chocolate chips and pour the batter into a greased loaf pan. Top with additional chocolate chips.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Bake for 50 minutes to an hour, or until a toothpick comes out clean.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Cool completely before serving.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

81f6dee07a37e9256e24e8be627224c6.title: Brown butter skillet chocolate chip cookie
81f6dee07a37e9256e24e8be627224c6.description: Brackets are complete and all that’s missing is food to fuel your team’s run. Huddle around the kitchen as Frankie preps the ultimate watch party spread. These savory, spicy and sweet dishes are championship-worthy even if your bracket goes bust.

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweet Cream Salted Butter, 16 oz
Great Value Light Brown Sugar, 32 oz
C&H Premium Pure Cane Granulated Sugar, 1 lb Box
Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value Pure Vanilla Extract, 1 fl oz
GV All Purpose Flour 2LB Bag
Great Value Baking Soda, 16 oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
Nestle Toll House Semi Sweet Chocolate Baking Chips, 24 oz Bag
Great Value Homestyle Vanilla Flavored Ice Cream, 48 fl oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Heat a skillet over medium heat and add 8 tablespoons butter. Cook while stirring constantly for 5-8 minutes until golden brown. Pour into a medium sized glass bowl and allow to cool slightly.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Whisk the sugar, brown sugar, egg and vanilla together with the browned butter. Stir in the flour, baking soda and salt until fully incorporated. Gently fold 1/2 cup of chocolate chips to the batter.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Grease the bottom and sides of a 10-inch cast iron skillet with the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter. Spread the cookie batter into an even, flat layer in the pan. Use the remaining chocolate chips to make a basketball pattern on the top of the cookie.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Bake for 20-25 minutes. Allow to cool slightly. Top with ice cream in the center when ready to serve.

ecde4a4ccb31257b222245aae0f54d5f.title: Easy caramel pecan pie
ecde4a4ccb31257b222245aae0f54d5f.description: This easy caramel pecan pie recipe is perfect for the fall holiday season. It takes just 10 minutes prep time and 20 minutes baking time. The secret to making this recipe in just 30 minutes is by using a store-bought pre-made pastry tart shell.

ingredients.name: Keebler Ready Crust Reduced Fat 9 Inch Graham Pie Crust, 6 oz
ingredients.description: 1 Pie Crust preferably pre-made refrigerated crust

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweet Cream Salted Butter, 16 oz
ingredients.description: 1/3 cup Butter melted and cooled down

ingredients.name: Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Maple Grove Farms Organic Pure Maple Syrup, 8.5 fl oz
Great Value Light Brown Sugar, 32 oz
GV All Purpose Flour 2LB Bag
Great Value Pure Vanilla Extract, 1 fl oz
Fisher Chopped Pecans, 16 Ounces
Great Value Homestyle Vanilla Flavored Ice Cream, 48 fl oz
ingredients.description: to taste Vanilla Ice Cream for serving or Whipped Cream (optional)

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C).

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Roll out the Pie Crust (1) to fit on a 9-inch pie plate. Poke holes with a fork into the dough to prevent it from over-puffing.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Arrange half of the Pecans (1 1/2 cups) on the base of the tart shell.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: In a medium mixing bowl, add Butter (1/3 cup) , Eggs (2) , Maple Syrup (1/2 cup) , Brown Sugar (1/2 cup) , All-Purpose Flour (1/4 cup) , and Vanilla Extract (1/2 Tbsp) . Whisk until smooth and well combined.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Carefully pour the mixture into the tart shell (not quite to the top). Gently place the remaining pecans and press down lightly into the mixture.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Bake in the oven for 20-25 minutes or until golden and cooked through.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Let the pie cool down, then cover with plastic wrap tightly and put in the fridge if not eaten right away.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Cut into triangles and serve warm with Vanilla Ice Cream (to taste) , if needed.

ingredients.name: Great Value White Chocolate Baking Bar, 4oz Box
Great Value Sweetened Condensed Milk 14 oz.
Great Value Duplex Sandwich Crme Cookies Family Size, 25 oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine chocolate with sweetened condensed milk and melt in the microwave in 15-second increments.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Once chocolate is fully melted, add in chopped cookies and stir until combined.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Pour chocolate mixture into a parchment paper-lined 8x8 inch (20x20 cm) baking tin.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Chill for 2 hours or until the fudge is firm.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Cut into bite-sized pieces.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweet Cream Salted Butter, 16 oz
Great Value Creamy Peanut Butter, 18 oz Jar
Great Value Confectioners Powdered Sugar, 32 oz
Great Value Semi-Sweet Chocolate Baking Chips, 12 oz
ingredients.description: 1 cup chocolate chips, enough for dipping

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Mix butter, peanut butter, and powdered sugar until well blended. More or less powdered sugar can be used to make mixture more or less dry.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Make 1 inch balls and freeze for about 20 minutes or until firm.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Microwave chocolate chips for 60 seconds, stopping every 15 seconds to check and stir. Adding some vegetable shortening can make the chocolate thinner and easier work with.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Remove balls from freezer and dip most of the way into the chocolate, coating all but a small circle on top. Using a toothpick for this works well but simply dipping it in and pulling it out with a fork also works. Place completed buckeyes on wax paper and allow to harden. Refrigerate if needed.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
ingredients.description: 4 eggs, beaten, reserve 2 tablespoons for your pastry dough, for custard filling,2 tablespoons egg, beaten, for pastry dough

ingredients.name: Great Value Spring Water, 1 Gallon
ingredients.description: 3/4 cup water, hot, for custard filling

ingredients.name: Great Value Sugar Cannister 20oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
ingredients.description: 1/8 teaspoon salt, pinch, for custard filling,1/8 teaspoon salt, for pastry dough

ingredients.name: Nestle Carnation Evaporated Milk, Vitamin D Added, 5 fl oz
ingredients.description: 1/4 cup evaporated milk, for custard filling

ingredients.name: Great Value Pure Vanilla Extract, 2 fl oz
ingredients.description: vanilla extract, a dash, optional, for custard filling,vanilla extract, a dash, optional

ingredients.name: Pillsbury Softasilk Cake Flour, 26 oz
ingredients.description: 2 cups cake flour, plus extra for dusting, for pastry dough

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweet Cream Unsalted Butter, 16 oz
ingredients.description: 115 g unsalted butter, room temperature, for pastry dough

ingredients.name: Great Value Confectioners Powdered Sugar, 32 oz
ingredients.description: 1/4 cup powdered sugar, for pastry dough

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: For the pastry, in a large bowl, sift flour, sugar, and salt. Then add softened butter. Bring the mixture together with your hands, careful not to knead the pastry dough too much or you will make the pastry tough.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Whisk the egg yolks and add the 2 tablespoons of beaten yolk to the flour mixture. Bring together until smooth. If the dough is too sticky, coating your hands with flour will help. Cover with plastic wrap and then refrigerate for 30 minutes, or until the dough is firm.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: To make the custard filling, melt sugar and salt with hot water. Mix until dissolved then let cool.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Add the rest of the beaten egg yolk. Stir in sugar water and also evaporated milk (if adding vanilla, add now). Stir and combine everything well.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Strain the filling to ensure no lumps. Chill in the refrigerator.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C.)

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Take the dough out and divide into 16 equal portions. Spray the tart pan with a light coating of oil. Take one portion of your dough and roll it into a ball and place in your tart shell. Press the shell into the pan with your fingers. Try to make the wrapper uniform in thickness and avoid a thick bottom. Repeat to finish all.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Pour the custard filling into the shells until it is about 80% full. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes until the surface becomes golden brown and a toothpick can stand in the egg tart.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Cool down for several minutes and then take the egg tarts out of the pan. Serve while still warm.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

3047fcb3fc467bf9f1d8af1e7a9bb51e.title: Pumpkin whoopie pies
3047fcb3fc467bf9f1d8af1e7a9bb51e.description: Don’t let the line of trick-or-treaters or the candy corn overload scare you out of the kitchen this Halloween. Frankie’s got tricks up his sleeve to make simple yet wicked good treats for everyone at the party to enjoy. All while saving some dough.

ingredients.name: GV All Purpose Flour 2LB Bag
ingredients.description: 3 cups all purpose flour for pumpkin cookies

ingredients.name: Great Value Kosher Ground Cinnamon, 2.5 Oz
Great Value Ground Nutmeg, 1.5 oz
ingredients.description: 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg for pumpkin cookies

ingredients.name: Great Value Double Acting Baking Powder, 8.1 oz
ingredients.description: 1 teaspoon baking powder for pumpkin cookies

ingredients.name: Great Value Baking Soda, 16 oz
ingredients.description: 1 teaspoon baking soda for pumpkin cookies

ingredients.name: Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
ingredients.description: 1 teaspoon salt for pumpkin cookies,Pinch of salt

ingredients.name: C&H Premium Pure Cane Granulated Sugar, 1 lb Box
ingredients.description: 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar for pumpkin cookies

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweet Cream Salted Butter, 16 oz
ingredients.description: 12 tablespoons butter, melted for pumpkin cookies,6 tablespoons butter, softened for cream cheese filling

ingredients.name: Great Value 100% Pure Pumpkin, 15 oz
ingredients.description: 1 1/2 cups canned pumpkin for pumpkin cookies

ingredients.name: Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value Pure Vanilla Extract, 1 fl oz
ingredients.description: 1 teaspoon vanilla extract for pumpkin cookies

ingredients.name: Great Value Confectioners Powdered Sugar, 32 oz
ingredients.description: 3 cups powdered sugar for cream cheese filling

ingredients.name: Great Value Cream Cheese, 8 oz
ingredients.description: 8 ounces cream cheese, softened for cream cheese filling

ingredients.name: Great Value Organic Strained Raw Honey, 12 oz Inverted Plastic Bottle
ingredients.description: 3 honey packets (or 3 teaspoons) for cream cheese filling

ingredients.name: Great Value 2% Reduced Fat Milk, Half Gallon, 64 fl oz
ingredients.description: 2 tablespoons milk for cream cheese filling

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Pumpkin Cookies - Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line 2 baking sheet trays with parchment paper

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Pumpkin Cookies - In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Pumpkin Cookies - In a large bowl, whisk the sugar, melted butter, canned pumpkin, egg and vanilla. Slowly stir the dry ingredients into the wet until just combined.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Pumpkin Cookies - Use a large spoon or a medium cookie scoop to dollop 2 tablespoons of batter onto the prepared baking sheets 2 inches apart. Wet your hand and gently press down to smooth over the tops. Bake for 15 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Pumpkin Cookies - Remove from the oven and let them cool completely.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Cream Cheese Filling - Whisk together the powdered sugar, cream cheese, butter, honey, milk and pinch of salt until smooth and fluffy. Spread the filling on half of the cooled pumpkin cookies, then sandwich a second cookie on top.

ingredients.name: Great Value Graham 9" Pie Crust, 6 oz
Splenda Monk Fruit Natural Zero Calorie Sweetener, Granulated Sugar Substitute - 19 oz.
Great Value Kosher Ground Cinnamon, 2.5 Oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
Great Value Ground Nutmeg, 1.5 oz
Concord Foods Lemon Juice, 4.5 oz
Great Value Sweet Cream Unsalted Butter, 16 oz
Anjou Pears, Each
ingredients.description: 8 medium-sized apple pears, sliced into thin wedges.

ingredients.name: Great Value Hazelnut Spread, 13 oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Preheat the oven to 425°F.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Mix together filling ingredients in a large mixing bowl and toss to coat & mix with apple pear slices.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Fill the pie crust with filling. Top thoroughly with crushed hazelnuts

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Bake for 40-45 minutes until the pie crust is golden brown and the apple pears are fork-tender- After 10-15 minutes, cover the pie in foil to prevent over browning of the crust and burning of the hazelnuts.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Cool on a wire rack for at least 2 hours. Then serve.

85b21de6df6011125b37be094950cf98.title: 5-Ingredient frozen yogurt bark
85b21de6df6011125b37be094950cf98.description: 5 ingredients are all it takes to create a yummy and healthy treat that is perfect for the entire family. 5-ingredient frozen yogurt bark is easy to put together and is a yummy way to satisfy a sweet tooth.

ingredients.name: Great Value Original Strawberry Lowfat Yogurt, 5.3 oz
Great Value Frozen Whole Berry Medley, 16 Oz
Great Value Oats & Honey Granola, 11 oz
Great Value Organic Unsweetened Coconut Flakes, 7 oz
Great Value Mixed Nuts Dessert Topping, 4 Oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Line the baking sheet with parchment paper.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Scoop the yogurt onto the parchment paper. Use a spatula to spread the yogurt evenly over the parchment paper.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Spread the frozen berry medley over the yogurt. Top with granola, crushed nuts, and coconut flakes.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Place the cookie sheet in the freezer for 3 hours or until the yogurt bark is firm.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: When the yogurt bark is firm, remove the parchment paper and cut or break it into pieces.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Serve immediately.

395858b640589188d10b438e333a5b22.title: How to make the best brownies
395858b640589188d10b438e333a5b22.description: How To Make The Best Brownies

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweet Cream Unsalted Butter, 16 oz
ingredients.description: 2 1/2 sticks unsalted butter, plus more, softened, for greasing

ingredients.name: Great Value Semi-Sweet Chocolate Baking Chips, 12 oz
ingredients.description: 8 oz good-quality semisweet chocolate, or bittersweet chocolate, 60-70% cacao, roughly chopped

ingredients.name: GHIRARDELLI Premium Baking Cocoa 100% Cocoa Dutch Process Unsweetened Cocoa Powder - 8 oz.
ingredients.description: 3/4 cup unsweetened dutch process cocoa powder, divided

ingredients.name: DeLallo, Gluten Free, Non-GMO, Instant Espresso Powder for Baking & Drinks, 100% Instant Coffee, Naturally Caffeinated, 1.94 oz Jar
C&H Premium Pure Cane Granulated Sugar, 1 lb Box
Great Value Light Brown Sugar, 32 oz
Great Value Pure Vanilla Extract, 1 fl oz
Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce
Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
King Arthur Flour Unbleached All-Purpose Flour 5 lb. Bag
Morton Sea Salt, Fine, 4.4 Ounce

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Grease a 9x13-inch (23x33-cm) dark metal pan with softened butter, then line with parchment paper, leaving overhang on all sides. Grease the parchment with softened butter.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Combine the chopped chocolate, ¼ cup (30 g) of cocoa powder, and espresso powder in a heatproof liquid measuring cup or medium bowl and set aside.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Add the butter to a small saucepan over medium heat and cook until the butter just comes to a vigorous simmer, about 5 minutes, swirling the pan occasionally. Immediately pour the hot butter over the chocolate mixture and let sit for 2 minutes. Whisk until the chocolate is completely smooth and melted, then set aside.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Combine the granulated sugar, brown sugar, vanilla extract, salt, and eggs in a large bowl. Beat with an electric hand mixer on high speed until light and fluffy, about 10 minutes. It will be similar to the texture of very thick pancake batter.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: With the mixer on, pour in the slightly cooled chocolate and butter mixture and blend until smooth.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Position a rack in the middle of the oven and preheat to 350°F (180°C).

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Sift in the flour and remaining cocoa powder and use a rubber spatula to gently fold until just combined.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan and smooth the top with a spatula. Bake until lightly puffed on top, about 20 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Remove the baking pan from the oven using oven mitts or kitchen towels, then lightly drop the pan on a flat surface 1-2 times until the brownies deflate slightly. Sprinkle with flaky sea salt.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Return the pan to the oven and bake until a wooden skewer inserted into the center of the brownies comes out fudgy but the edges look cooked through, about 20 minutes more. The center of the brownies will seem under-baked, but the brownies will continue to set as they cool.

tasks.title: Step 11
tasks.instruction: Set the brownies on a cooling rack and cool completely in the pan.

tasks.title: Step 12
tasks.instruction: Use the parchment paper to lift the cooled brownies out of the pan. Cut into 24 bars and serve immediately.

tasks.title: Step 13
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

91291a0fa25ba583756270476a71aa61.title: How to make perfect chocolate chip cookies
91291a0fa25ba583756270476a71aa61.description: How To Make Perfect Chocolate Chip Cookies

ingredients.name: Gold Medal Premium Quality Unbleached Bread Flour, 5 lb.
King Arthur Flour Unbleached All-Purpose Flour 5 lb. Bag
Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce
ingredients.description: 2 teaspoons kosher salt, or 1 1/2 teaspoons table salt

ingredients.name: Great Value Baking Soda, 16 oz
Great Value Sweet Cream Unsalted Butter, 16 oz
Great Value Spring Water, 1 Gallon
C&H Premium Pure Cane Dark Brown Sugar, 2 lb
C & H Pure Granulated White Cane Sugar, 4 lb
Great Value Pure Vanilla Extract, 1 fl oz
DeLallo, Gluten Free, Non-GMO, Instant Espresso Powder for Baking & Drinks, 100% Instant Coffee, Naturally Caffeinated, 1.94 oz Jar
Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value Semi-Sweet Chocolate Baking Chips, 12 oz
Great Value Dark Chocolate Bar, 3.52 oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: In a medium bowl, sift together the flours, salt, and baking soda. Set aside.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In a medium or large saucepan, add the butter and melt over medium heat. The larger the pan you use, the quicker the process will be!

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Bring the butter to a boil, stirring frequently. As the water begins to boil out of the butter, the milk solids in the butter will separate, sink to the bottom, and begin to toast and brown. As this begins to happen, make sure to stir constantly so the butter browns evenly. It may become quite foamy, splatter a bit, and be difficult to see, so keep a close eye on it, removing from heat and continuing to stir if it starts to foam over.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Once the butter has turned a nice nutty brown, remove from the heat and pour into a large liquid measuring cup to stop the cooking. Allow it to cool down for a minute or two, give it a stir, and carefully add 2-3 tablespoons of water to the butter to bring it back up to 1 cup (240 ml) of liquid.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Set aside to cool to room temperature. To help speed this process up, you can place in the fridge for 10-15 minutes. You want to make sure the butter is still liquid when you’re adding it to the dough later on, so make sure to remove after 15 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: In a large bowl, add the sugars, vanilla, espresso powder, and cooled brown butter. Cream together with an electric hand mixer until light and fluffy, 1-2 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Add the egg and yolk and beat until incorporated.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Add the dry ingredients, about 1/3 of the mixture at a time, and beat between additions until just incorporated. It’s okay for there to be a bit of unmixed flour on the edge of bowl, this will be incorporated in the next step.

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Using a wooden spoon, fold the chocolate chips and chunks into the dough

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Scoop the cookies onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet in 3-tablespoon-sized mounds.

tasks.title: Step 11
tasks.instruction: For optimal flavor, cover and refrigerate for 1 hour or, even better, overnight.

tasks.title: Step 12
tasks.instruction: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).

tasks.title: Step 13
tasks.instruction: Evenly space the dough 3 inches (8 cm) apart from one another on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet.

tasks.title: Step 14
tasks.instruction: Bake in a preheated oven for 12-14 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 15
tasks.instruction: Let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for 2-3 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack to cool completely.

tasks.title: Step 16
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Great Value Heavy Whipping Cream, 16 Oz
ingredients.description: 1/2 cup heavy cream, room temperature for cheesecake

ingredients.name: LouAna 100% Pure Coconut Oil, 14 fl oz
Great Value Cream Cheese, 8 oz
ingredients.description: 32 oz cream cheese, softened for cheesecake

ingredients.name: Great Value Spring Water, 1 Gallon
C&H Premium Pure Cane Granulated Sugar, 1 lb Box
ingredients.description: 2 cups granulated sugar for peanut brittle

ingredients.name: Great Value Twist & Shout Double Filled Chocolate Sandwich Cookies, 20 oz
ingredients.description: 1 package chocolate sandwich cookie for cheesecake

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweet Cream Unsalted Butter, 16 oz
ingredients.description: 3/4 stick unsalted butter, cubed for peanut brittle, 3/4 stick unsalted butter, melted for cheesecake

ingredients.name: Great Value Canola Oil Non-Stick Cooking Spray, 8 oz
ingredients.description: nonstick cooking spray, for greasing for cheesecake

ingredients.name: Great Value Semi-Sweet Chocolate Baking Chips, 12 oz
ingredients.description: 1/4 cup semisweet chocolate chips for cheesecake

ingredients.name: Great Value Salted & Roasted In Shell Peanuts, 20 oz
ingredients.description: 1 1/2 cups roasted, salted peanuts for peanut brittle

ingredients.name: Morton Kosher Salt, Coarse, 16 Ounce
Great Value Confectioners Powdered Sugar, 32 oz
Great Value Pure Vanilla Extract, 1 fl oz
Great Value Baking Soda, 16 oz
ingredients.description: 1/2 teaspoon baking soda for peanut brittle

ingredients.name: Great Value Light Corn Syrup, 16 fl oz
ingredients.description: 1/2 cup light corn syrup for peanut brittle

ingredients.name: SKIPPY Peanut Butter, Creamy, 7G Protein per Serving, 16.3 oz Jar
ingredients.description: 1 cup Skippy® Creamy Peanut Butter for cheesecake

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Make the cheesecake: Preheat the oven to 325°F (160°C). Grease a 10-inch springform pan with nonstick spray.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Add the sandwich cookies to a food processor and process into fine crumbs. Pour in the melted butter and pulse several times, until the crumbs are moistened.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Pour the cookie crumbs into the prepared springform pan, pressing evenly against the bottom and halfway up the sides.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Bake the crust for 10 minutes, until slightly puffed. Remove from the oven, transfer to a wire rack, and let cool completely, about 30 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese with an electric hand mixer on high speed until smooth. Add the peanut butter, heavy cream, vanilla, powdered sugar, and salt and beat on medium speed until smooth.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Pour the filling over the cooled crust. Transfer the cheesecake to the refrigerator and chill until firm, at least 6 hours, or overnight.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Meanwhile, make the peanut brittle: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: In a medium saucepan fitted with a candy thermometer, combine the granulated sugar, corn syrup, and water. Bring to a boil over medium heat and cook, stirring frequently, until the syrup is golden brown and the temperature reaches 340°F (170°C).

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: Working very quickly, remove the pot from the heat and stir in the butter and baking soda until well combined; the mixture will foam. Stir in the peanuts until well incorporated.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Immediately pour the peanut mixture onto the prepared baking sheet and spread evenly with a spatula. Let cool for 15–20 minutes, then break into small pieces.

tasks.title: Step 11
tasks.instruction: Just before serving, combine the chocolate chips and coconut oil in a small microwave-safe bowl. Microwave for 30-second intervals, stirring between, until completely melted and smooth.

tasks.title: Step 12
tasks.instruction: Release the springform and transfer the cheesecake to a serving platter or cake stand. Scatter the peanut brittle on top of the cheesecake and drizzle with the melted chocolate.

tasks.title: Step 13
tasks.instruction: Slice with a warm knife, wiping clean between cuts, and serve.

tasks.title: Step 14
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Freshness Guaranteed Gala Apples, 3 lb Bag
Lemons, Each
Ocean Spray Jellied Cranberry Sauce, 14 oz Can
Argo Cornstarch 100% Cornstarch Gluten free
C & H Pure Granulated White Cane Sugar, 4 lb
Maple Grove Farms Organic Pure Maple Syrup, 8.5 fl oz
Great Value Kosher Ground Cinnamon, 2.5 Oz
Great Value Whole Grain Quick rolled Oats
Great Value Light Brown Sugar, 32 oz
King Arthur Flour Unbleached All-Purpose Flour 5 lb. Bag
Great Value Sweet Cream Salted Butter, 16 oz
Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
Little Debbie Fudge Rounds Ice Cream, Fudge Crme with Fudgy Chocolatey Cookie, Pint
ingredients.description: ice cream, to taste, for topping

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C).

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: In a large bowl, gently combine apples, lemon juice, cranberries, cornstarch, sugar, syrup, and cinnamon.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Pour into a 9x13-inch (23x33cm) baking dish and bake for 30 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: In another bowl, combine oats, brown sugar, flour, butter, and salt until well-incorporated.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Sprinkle the oat topping evenly over the baked fruit and bake for another 15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Serve with ice cream on top.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Great Value Confectioners Powdered Sugar, 32 oz
Great Value Creamy Peanut Butter, 18 oz Jar
Great Value Milk Chocolate Baking Chips, 11.5 oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: Prepare a cupcake tin with 6 liners.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Stir peanut butter and powdered sugar together until smooth.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Spread 1 to 2 tablespoons of chocolate in the bottom of each cupcake liner.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Dollop 1 to 2 teaspoons of the peanut butter mixture on top of the chocolate.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Cover each dollop of peanut butter with more chocolate and smooth out the top.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: Refrigerate for 1 hour or until chocolate has hardened.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Remove peanut butter cups from the liners.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Enjoy!

5903f43b678f63466868f3afd3bea811.title: Strawberries with mint whipped cream
5903f43b678f63466868f3afd3bea811.description: This strawberries and creamy mint dessert is a great healthy alternative to heavy cakes and pies. The combination of berries and mint is a classic you can’t go wrong with. This dessert is light as a feather and still full of flavor.

ingredients.name: Fresh Strawberries, 8.8 oz
Great Value Sugar Cannister 20oz
Mint Fresh Cut, 0.75 oz
ingredients.description: 1 1/2 packed cups Mint leaves and stems, coarsely chopped, plus sprigs for garnish

ingredients.name: Great Value Heavy Whipping Cream, 16 Oz
Great Value Spring Water, 1 Gallon

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: In a medium saucepan, put sugar, mint, and water and bring to a boil. Reduce the water and mint mixture to a glaze consistency, about 3-4 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Remove from heat and steep for 5-10 minutes.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: After it has steeped, strain the mixture and discard the solids. Let it cool down to room temperature.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: While it is cooling, in a large bowl, whip the cream until it reaches stiff peaks. You can check this by the cream standing straight up when you turn the whisk facing up. Gently fold in 1/4 cup syrup, be careful not to break the stiff peaks. If needed, re-whip cream to stiff peaks.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Spoon with the strawberries, alternate between layers of strawberries and cream. Garnish with extra mint leaves on top.

ingredients.name: King Arthur Flour Unbleached All-Purpose Flour 5 lb. Bag
ingredients.description: 2 1/2 cups flour, for pie dough,2 tablespoons flour

ingredients.name: Great Value Iodized Salt, 26 oz
ingredients.description: 1 teaspoon salt, for pie dough,1/2 teaspoon salt

ingredients.name: Great Value Sweet Cream Salted Butter, 16 oz
ingredients.description: 1 1/2 sticks butter, 1 1/2 sticks, cold, cubed, for pie dough

ingredients.name: Great Value Spring Water, 1 Gallon
ingredients.description: 8 tablespoons ice water, or as needed, for pie dough

ingredients.name: Granny Smith Apples, Each
ingredients.description: 2 1/2 lb granny smith apple, cored, sliced, peeled, for filling

ingredients.name: Great Value Sugar Cannister 20oz
Great Value Kosher Ground Cinnamon, 2.5 Oz
Great Value Ground Nutmeg, 1.5 oz
Lemons, Each
Great Value Cage Free Large AA White Eggs, 12 Count
Great Value Homestyle Vanilla Flavored Ice Cream, 48 fl oz

tasks.title: Step 1
tasks.instruction: In a medium-sized bowl, add the flour and salt. Mix with fork until combined.

tasks.title: Step 2
tasks.instruction: Add in cubed butter and break up into flour with a fork. Mixture will still have lumps about the size of small peas.

tasks.title: Step 3
tasks.instruction: Gradually add the ice water and continue to mix until the dough starts to come together. You may not need all of the water, but if the dough is too dry then add more. The dough should not be very tacky or sticky.

tasks.title: Step 4
tasks.instruction: Work the dough together with your hands and turn out onto a surface. Work into a ball and cover with cling wrap. Refrigerate.

tasks.title: Step 5
tasks.instruction: Peel the apples, then core and slice.

tasks.title: Step 6
tasks.instruction: In a bowl, add the sliced apples, sugar, flour, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and juice from the lemon.

tasks.title: Step 7
tasks.instruction: Mix until combined and all apples are coated. Refrigerate.

tasks.title: Step 8
tasks.instruction: Preheat the oven to 375°F (200°C).

tasks.title: Step 9
tasks.instruction: On a floured surface, cut the pie dough in half and roll out both halves until round and about 1/8-inch (3 mm) thick.

tasks.title: Step 10
tasks.instruction: Roll the dough around the rolling pin and unroll onto a pie dish making sure the dough reaches all edges. Trim extra if necessary.

tasks.title: Step 11
tasks.instruction: Pour in apple filling mixture and pat down.

tasks.title: Step 12
tasks.instruction: Roll the other half of the dough on top.

tasks.title: Step 13
tasks.instruction: Trim the extra dough from the edges and pinch the edges to create a crimp. Make sure edges are sealed together.

tasks.title: Step 14
tasks.instruction: Brush the pie with the beaten egg and sprinkle with the sugar.

tasks.title: Step 15
tasks.instruction: Cut four slits in the top of the pie to create a vent.

tasks.title: Step 16
tasks.instruction: Bake pie for 50-60 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and no greyish or undercooked pastry remains.

tasks.title: Step 17
tasks.instruction: Allow to cool completely before slicing.

tasks.title: Step 18
tasks.instruction: Bake at 350’F for 10 minutes and set aside to cool.

tasks.title: Step 19
tasks.instruction: Top with ice cream and serve.
